author: {'steamid': '76561198036538203', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1709449352}
review:
An impressively simple puzzle game with a cohesive premise. There are lines that need to be completed on some blocks, causing them to light up, and when all the pieces are lit up, you've won the puzzle and loft off to the next one.

It gets more complex as the game goes forward. Soon you're introduced to '3-D' shapes, and then black tiles that must be made non-contiguous to any other black tiles in order to become dots of light, a likewise condition for ongoing to the next puzzle.

The presentation brings what would be bearable, into the fun. The colors are simple yet clear, soft yet bold; the lighting effects have a satisfying bloom to them, and when you solve a puzzle, a bloom softer comes over the screen and a slow camera zoom asserts your success.

This game's proof that sometimes you don't need a hard-hitting, complex game with a big story or power fantasy to have fun. Sometimes a good puzzle with great presentation is what hits the spot. Recommend, especially for the price; if you're conscientious, wait for a sale for about $1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119598326', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1708969001}
review:
[b][h1]klocki[/h1][/b]klocki is a short, casual, minimalist puzzle game about arranging lines and shapes by switching tiles. It's really straightforward with simple mechanics and can be completed in under an hour, great for a quick session if you have an itch for a puzzle game.

[b][h2]Gameplay[/h2][/b]The game is split into levels, with the simple premise of each being to arrange the lines, dots and shapes into the correct patterns. You learn by trial and error but it isn't very difficult to figure out the solution and so it ends up being a fairly relaxing experience. The final level is quite a cute way to end the whole thing.

[b][h2]Achievement (1/1)[/h2][/b]There is a single achievement for completing all the levels.

[b][h2]Music/sound[/h2][/b]Relaxing music.

[b][h2]Settings/Accessibility/Misc[/h2][/b]Runs well on low-end hardware. Level select available.

[quote][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/39729435-JHG-Reviews/?appid=2218750]Check out my Curator page[/url][/quote]

Senti falta de um menu de configuraÃ§Ã£o, por mais simples que seja, pois isso Ã© Ãºtil em alguns casos.

Um ponto muito interessante Ã© a diversidade de mecÃ¢nicas. HÃ¡ uns 5 ou 6 tipos diferentes de mecÃ¢nicas para resolver os quebra cabeÃ§as e, em vÃ¡rios momentos, vocÃª farÃ¡ uso de mÃºltiplas formas ao mesmo tempo.

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1705775656}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right handâ€”the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bedâ€”the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031606412', 'num_games_owned': 998, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1673861224}

author: {'steamid': '76561199000064982', 'num_games_owned': 755, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1700075239}
review:
[b]Tl;dr:[/b] Klocki does not feel like a puzzle game but a toy.

I understand the casual relaxing nature of the game, but [b]the puzzle experience, I'm afraid, is not there.[/b] Maybe it is just that the pacing is not right, but I think I have played enough levels to see if there is something intriguing about the game puzzle-wise.

The game feels like an interactive digital app where you click on the screen to see things forming a fancy structure where there isn't much thinking needed. [b]Most of the "solutions" are too easy to figure out[/b] in the game, and they simply don't make you feel like you are solving a puzzle at all.

If you would like to click on the screen and see things become fancy, you can get Klocki; but, [b]if you are someone who favors logical puzzles over relaxing scenery[/b] in your minimalist puzzle games, [b]this game doesÂ notÂ offerÂ that.[/b]

review: A nice short puzzle game. I really loved the mechanics. It looked interesting. But my main complaint would be that the puzzles were extremely easy. There is hardly any challenge. Breezed through it in an hour and forgot about it. Wish there was a lot more and with an increased difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076521369', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1696884212}
review:
very fun game, sad to be leaving a downvote. played it on kongregate, a fantastic demo for a game that i gladly shelled out 2 bucks for. the promise of course was more levels of the game- the added slide mechanic or weird egg shapey puzzles were cool, but, for example, only 2 puzzles used the four way egg peice. it ended in maybe 10 minutes more than the free version, and nowhere was it depicted how many levels or play time.

i highly recommend this game, just make sure you know youll get a little under an hour for it, which i didn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010905516', 'num_games_owned': 836, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1691377926}
review: Maciej Targoni gets me again with another one of these great little puzzlers. My brain hates how much I enjoy your games, if you're reading this. As usual Klocki is a minimalist puzzler with a ton of colorful and legible brain teasers. Incredibly easy at first to get a hang of the ropes and the true challenges coming near the last few. The only thing I would say is the number of different puzzle elements was a bit overwhelming in this particular title, but it was a good time nonetheless. Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197965891622', 'num_games_owned': 855, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1702587735}
review: A beautifully relaxing game where you can just take each puzzle at your own pace. A little easy you may think but that's what I like about it. If you want to play something casual and stress free, with a satisfaction from each completed puzzle, this would be a good game to pick up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030707783', 'num_games_owned': 703, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1687856176}
review:
A very cute, little, minimalistic puzzle game. The mechanics are varied and introduced at a good pace and combine interestingly enough without any one puzzle being too taxing. A little short, ending just as the puzzles are starting to get challenging, but that's hardly a complaint when you can pick it for a buck on sale.

There are a few technical issues, like the uncapped framerate and other defaults that the game gives you no way of adjusting in-game, but again these are minor when you consider the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275655828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1687283291}
review:
Klochi's problem is that it's too easy and too unfocused. There's so much thrown in but rarely will you be hung up on any problem for too long as it's never too difficult.

Also I wish there was a menu so we could go to the start easier rather than just cycling through all the levels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154135669', 'num_games_owned': 848, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1685636616}
review: Absolutely delightful, new puzzle pieces were explained nicely, and given out just often enough to keep me interested. It's not a hard puzzle game, but it's very elegant.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992511533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1686368305}
review: An excellent little puzzle game! Very short and easy, but also very chill. More of a relaxing than puzzling experience. Does a good job of introducing new mechanics and then mixing them with previous elements. Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007845342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 370, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1686243370}
review:
I completed NABOKI, really good puzzle game by Maciej Targoni.
Went to complete klocki next, underestimated it, was proven wrong.
Good game too :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198064923796', 'num_games_owned': 359, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1686072346}
review:
It's a decent minimalist puzzler for a low price. The difficulty curve is reasonable, but most puzzles can be more or less brute forced without any real strategy.  Alright graphics, but the sound effects of moving pieces and completing lines is pretty unpleasant. Unfortunately, this, combined with lack of any sort QoL features like reset or undo buttons, or a level screen push this into "not worth it" territory for me.

4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198101950038', 'num_games_owned': 2371, 'num_reviews': 324, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1685830232}
review: klocki is a short and smart puzzle game where you combine pieces of puzzles together. The game is simple and  gets relatively challenging towards the end, but nothing too tough. I love that it trains your mind and it was really satisfying to complete too. However, the game abruptly looped once it ended and I continued going on, not knowing the game was done, so just take note. Still a great puzzle game. Definitely recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198159014827', 'num_games_owned': 358, 'num_reviews': 276, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1683314132}
review:
Another minimalistic puzzle game from Maciej Targoni. I do like how each one has a unique gimmick, makes them distinct.

I still recommend buying his games as part of the "Relaxing Puzzle Box" bundle. Gives you a nice dozen-ish hours of puzzles to go through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044161322', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1682380361}
review:
Another excellent minimalistic puzzle game by the same creator as Hook. The rules for the various puzzle elements are not explained to you and must be figured out, which is mostly easy going. I enjoyed almost all of the game except for the tile moving segments, which felt more of a chore because the solution was almost always obvious, it was the execution which was fiddly and time-consuming.

Nevertheless, at this low price I can say the game is definitely worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027047516', 'num_games_owned': 2313, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1682259340}
review:
This review is specially made for those who like to get all the achievements in games.
Minor spoilers ahead.

[b]Description:[/b]
Klocki is an easy minimalist puzzle game. The puzzles are 3D objects that have different tiles on them that need to be manipulated. Each chapter adds different mechanics and types of puzzles, but most are about pattern making/recognition. The last levels mix several of these mechanics and puzzle types making the levels slightly harder.

The presentation is simple, with 3D objects placed over a plain colored background, and has some similarities with Hook, another game created by the same Dev.
There is no interface or chapter select, so the levels need to be completed in their order. The [b][u][url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AVwxL_y_SQo] soundtrack[/url][/u][/b] is surprisingly good for a cheap game and provides a relaxing environment that doesnâ€™t interfere with the thinking process. 

The gameplay relies on the mouse only: you need to click on the tiles to create paths, patterns and/or shapes to complete the levels. Most only took me a few seconds but others are not so obvious and take a bit more.


[b]Achievements:[/b]  
[b]How many:[/b] 1 Achievement.
[b]How much time:[/b] Around 1,5 hours, without any help.
[b]Game difficulty:[/b] Very Easy, with a few slightly harder levels.
[b]Achievementsâ€™ Difficulty:[/b] Very Easy, just complete all the levels.


[b]Overall opinion:[/b]  
Klocki is a short and easy minimalist puzzle game. The presentation is simple, the soundtrack is good and the puzzles are varied and well designed but most donâ€™t require much effort to complete. 


[b]Join and follow my group [u][url=store.steampowered.com/curator/42556190-Ribbon-Hunters/] Ribbon Hunters[/url][/u] for more suggestions and reviews of easy indie games to get all the achievements.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970565583', 'num_games_owned': 1345, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1682140070}
review: Very short and minimalist puzzle game that teaches new mechanisms with every level and gets increasingly complex. At first I thought there wasn't much challenge to the game as the introductory levels feel like busy work but this is just to get you to understand the controls and what is possible within these rules. Then the game starts to add new mechanics without telling you how they work; you have to just play and experiment and see how the pieces interact and finding out what the win condition is. Excellent visuals and great puzzle design. I bought this in a pack of minimalist puzzle games and it was well worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198814250534', 'num_games_owned': 773, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1682012009}
review: It's well polished for a game this cheap. On the puzzle game scale, this one is easy and relaxing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992158143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 1015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 952, 'last_played': 1681833653}
review: Supposedly there are 82 levels, I am at almost 100 and no achievement pop.  It looks like it has started to repeat levels, but since there is no menu to see what levels you have one, I can;t be sure.  Well, it finally popped, so I am updating my review.  Other than the lack of a menu, the puzzles are nice, a spread of easy ones with some difficult ones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126610501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1697921433}
review: Relaxing and colorful minimalistic puzzle game, where your goal is to arrange tiles and connect (not just) lines to make an uninterrupted flow of light, on two- and three-dimensional layouts. There are total 60 levels, of which 2/3 are absurdly easy and their purpose is to teach the logic of the puzzles, and the remaining third is more challenging. But overall the game is not too difficult, and with the subdued background music makes for a nice relaxing experience that will train your mind a little as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049036335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1674896579}
review:
Very good game at a very low price. There are quite a lot minimalistic puzzle games, but this one really blew my mind because of the ideas and mechanisms in it. Whenever you think you mastered one of the mechanisms, the next level introduces something new for your mind to twist around. The levels get quite tricky at times, but they're not hard in a logical sense rather than in a creative sense. You simply have to see and figure out how everything matches together.

I found the game very entertaining, yet still challenging. There are a few things you should know though:
- The game is VERY simplicistic. There barely are any settings and it totally lacks any explanations. You have to figure out everything on your own, including controls. However, since the left mouse button is everything you need, it's rather intuitive after a short time.
- There are only 84 levels and the game silently repeats from the beginning after completing the final level. I did not notice otherwise than suddenly wondering about the easy levels coming up. ;) However, it also triggers the only available achievement in this game, which I simply didn't notice. It's still good for several days of fun if you don't rush the levels.
- For me, the game had problems with tabbing out to the desktop (alt+tab) when running in fullscreen mode. No crashes though, but it always shuffeled my windows around. I solved this by playing in window mode and using the Borderless Gaming tool to turn it into a maximized borderless window, thus looking like fullscreen.
- Unfortunately, there's no fps cap in this game. Hence it renders at >2000 fps, maxing out your GPU and unnecessarily wasting energy and producing heat. I solved this by forcing vertical synchronization on, using the NVIDIA control panel and managing the 3D settings for klocki. It ran nice and smoothly afterwards.

So all in all: Fantastic game, highly recommended! It has some technical flaws, but all of them can be handled easily.

review:
Good: Not so difficult, suitable for new-comers. Good visuals. Several interesting mechanics.
Bad: UI needs quality-of-life changes. e.g. there's no level list. I didn't even recognize when I finished the game, it just restarts! Had to re-install and start again to have it register by achievement. Some puzzles felt repetitive.
Verdict: 7/10 A short-but-nice entertaining puzzler

review:
[h1]Eine Herausforderung fÃ¼r Konzentration und rÃ¤umliches DenkvermÃ¶gen[/h1]

Klocki ist ein unglaublich fesselndes Puzzle-Spiel, das die Aufmerksamkeit und die FÃ¤higkeiten der Spieler auf die Probe stellt. Das Spielprinzip ist einfach: Man muss kleine Bausteine in eine vorgegebene Form zusammensetzen, um das Level zu meistern.

Das Spiel bietet eine Vielzahl von Herausforderungen, die immer schwieriger werden, je weiter man kommt. Man muÃŸ Konzentration und rÃ¤umliches DenkvermÃ¶gen einsetzen, um die Bausteine an der richtigen Stelle zu platzieren und so das Puzzle zu lÃ¶sen.

Insgesamt ist Klocki ein groÃŸartiges Spiel fÃ¼r alle, die Puzzles mÃ¶gen und ihre FÃ¤higkeiten im rÃ¤umlichen Denken verbessern mÃ¶chten. Es ist ein perfektes Spiel fÃ¼r eine kurze Pause zwischendurch oder fÃ¼r lÃ¤ngere Spielperioden. Ich kann es nur empfehlen. Gerade auch weil es auch meist zu einem extrem gÃ¼nstigen Preis angeboten wird.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157328031', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1668877090}
review:
Reviewing a 2 dollar puzzle game poorly is probably overkill but I decided this is a thing I'm going to do. See, I used to feel anxious and overwhelmed at bigger games and I liked in the abstract the idea of abstract puzzle games, so I bought a lot of these.

So, klocki starts out good and interesting. The visuals and controls, its sense of minimalism and calm are nice and satisfying and there isn't too much grind. The visual arrangement after completing one feels nice. The mechanics are nice and interesting when introduced, and the idea of how they incorporate is interesting.

But, it never seems to know how to mesh its ideas. See, it runs into the trap of throwing in more mechanics but not really doing much with them. The 'peak' of each mechanic is fairly simple. It keeps you thinking 'oh, thats interesting, I wonder where it goes next' and throws in another thing... and another... but, apart from the rotating board, never really providing any real context, depth, or zen to them. It starts off the impression that way, but it fades in later half. Its a game that you feel supposed to zone in to but you don't. Lots of filler where if you just find where the corners are, can juts click click click and done.

And then... it is suddenly over. So you come in enjoying it, but has a lifeline cut so short that makes it feel empty.

It also has the issue that... to put it one way, the fact there *is* a solution basically necessitates by just connecting stuff you arrive at that solution rather than feeling a genuine pathway to a solution. You can also just say 'hey, I know this needs to go that way' and the mere existence of a solution will just easily lead you that way. 

Now, I get this is a casual game and I probably ought to be a hardcore puzzler-but I can appreciate a zen game, it just needs to convey that zen. LYNE, Achromatic, Knights, even Hook by same creator I think accomplish that better. Also, I don't think 'zen' should be opposite to 'interesting'. A good zen puzzle game zones you in. A certain thoughtful, mindful state that focuses you in on your task-but in a blissful way. I didn't get that here. Its probably worth trying it out on sale, but for 2 dollars (though often sale) when other 1 dollar games feel more complete, feels incomplete.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067888927', 'num_games_owned': 1632, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1660878135}
review: I've played a lot of puzzle games and I appreciate the simplistic aesthetic to an extent... but I just want to know how much progress I've made in these games as I go. Let's face it, puzzle games are just about appeasing our monkey brains with a reward system that makes us feel accomplished. For me, part of the "carrot on a stick" that keeps me chasing the conclusion is knowing that I'm meeting milestones. Klocki gives you no sense of how close you are to achieving that ultimate goal and I lost my motivation for that reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561198338994084', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1660748943}
review:
Klocki is a peaceful puzzle game with beautiful, calming audio and visuals that complement each other well. The absence of timer and move limit creates an environment without pressure. I appreciated the "show; don't tell" approach. The game has no text, and the player learns new mechanics in simple levels that increase in difficulty before beginning to reincorporate previous mechanics. After 82 levels in about one hour, klocki ends while it is still interesting. 

The minimalism might go too far by not providing a menu to navigate through the levels faster, though players will likely play each level once without desire to go back to a particular one anyway. When the game ends, it loops back to the first level. I thought it would have been nice to include something special here to acknowledge completion of all levels.

I encountered a bug at the end. I closed the game and noticed I had not yet earned the completion achievement, so I opened it again. I had to jump forwards through all the levels and finish the last one again. It looped back to the first level again, but this time I could click back to go straight to the last level, and I had earned the achievement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088193749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1657564131}
review:
Very short (probably too short as it took me 34 minutes + left running for cards). Levels are not really challenging. There is decent number of mechanics and I only regret that they are not explored more deeply. 

Technically the game is done really well. It does not have menu and closing is quite weird, but these are not  real problems.

I hoped for more, but it wasn't a let down - would rate it as 'Maybe', but Steam is much more binary...

author: {'steamid': '76561198063388194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1657288496}
review:
Very short puzzle games with a variety of very simple basics that when you layer them all on top of eachother makes for more complicated puzzles, still not hard though. I found the green pieces really hard to wrap my head around but other than that it was smooth sailing.

Took 55 minutes to complete.

review:
Klocki is a great puzzle game for an evening night, doesnt take too long to figure out, not too expensive for its nice graphics and easy to understand puzzles
i easily recommend this game to people that want to try out a puzzle game, doesnt need too much out of the box thinking but is entertaining enough to keep someones attention, nice visuals too :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198105042729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1653656371}
review: I'm a fan of minimalist games like Islanders and shapez.io, but this game doesn't cut it. I paid $2 for it and I didn't get anywhere near $2 worth of fun.  The most puzzling aspect of the game is figuring out what the object of the current puzzle is.  Once you understand it, it's trivial to solve it.  But then you have to go through a dozen exactly like it to get to the next "level".  I'm not sure how far I got through the game, but it's simply too tedious to continue.  If I could fast forward through the levels, I might be more interested.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072580497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1652220293}
review:
This deserves all the praise it gets. It helped my mind relax while fooling it in thinking that it is smart :)

In case your completion achievement bugs out and is not awarded when you finish the game, just uninstall and reinstall the game, and reboot it. The achievement will be automatically granted.

My only criticism is that there is no frame rate cap and my GPU was running the game at one billion frames per second. It is not even winter (at the time of my playthrough), so I actually had to grab ice packs and staff them under my armpits to avoid heatstroke from my active-volcano PC tower.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063825413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 804, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1649615864}
review:
Ein einfaches RÃ¤tselspiel. Wie fand ich es?

[b]Gameplay[/b]

Bei den vielleicht 100 Leveln muss man PlÃ¤ttchen mit augezeichneten Linien so vertauschen, dass diese Linien zusammenhÃ¤ngen. Dieser RÃ¤tseltyp wird dann verschiedentlich variiert, z.B. FlÃ¤chen statt Linien, oder man kann die PlÃ¤tchen auch drehen, oder 3D statt 2D, etc.

Die RÃ¤tsel waren nicht sonderlich schwierig, aber mir lag das RÃ¤tseldesign auch. So hatte ich nur bei manchen RÃ¤tseln etwas zu tÃ¼fteln. Durch logische Annahmen und etwas probieren ging es aber immer zÃ¼gig voran. Ganz offensichtlich, dass man mit diesem RÃ¤tselprinzip schwere RÃ¤tsel machen hÃ¤tte kÃ¶nnen, wollte man aber nicht.

[b]Technik[/b]

Das Spiel prÃ¤sentiert sich eher minimalistisch. Fast kein MenÃ¼, keine ErklÃ¤rung (war auch unnÃ¶tig), kein sonstwas. Angenehme Hintergrundmusik gab es immerhin dazu. Bedienung mit der Maus problemlos. Dass man das Spiel diesmal mit Esc beendet, hÃ¤tte nicht sein mÃ¼ssen.

[b]Sonstiges[/b]

In 1,5h war ich durch und hatte damit die einizge Errungenschaft freigeschaltet.

[code][b]In Zahlen fÃ¼r mich persÃ¶nlich ein Unterhaltungswert von 7/10.[/b][/code]

Ein einfaches Puzzlespiel etwas anderer Art. Zum entspannten Zeitvertreib geeignet.

[hr][/hr]
[i]Dies ist mein subjektiver Spieleindruck. FÃ¼r meine Wertung zÃ¤hlt, wie gut es mich unterhalten hat. Entsprechend der Daumen nach oben oder unten, abhÃ¤ngig davon, ob ich es einem Ã¤hnlich gesinnten Spieler weiterempfehle. Der Spieleindruck eines anderen Spielers kann aber durchaus stark davon abweichen.[/i]

Eine andere Sicht auf das Spiel findet man beispielsweise [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/VeryImpressed/recommended/499440/]hier[/url].

PS: Screenshots werden nur scheinbar gemacht, aber irgendwie nicht richtig verarbeitet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025016532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1643914096}
review:
This is a short, but sweet puzzle game, featuring mostly intuitive puzzle design with a minimalist approach to graphics and puzzles.

The music and sound effects are just fine (nothing extraordinary, but who needs them for a game like this?!?), the graphics are more than sufficient, and there is a wide variety of puzzles to solve, with the basic fundamentals changing every 10 or 15 levels or so.

I do have one serious caveat, and that is that the point of the puzzle is rather opaque from time to time, i.e. what you have to do to solve it, vis a vis the actual game mechanics required to achieve a win-state, and sometimes what that win-state will even look like are not always broadcast clearly to the player (if you look at a playthrough or Steam guide, it will usually become apparent what it is you were supposed to be working towards to "solve" the puzzle, but it is truly not always clear at all without outside help).

All in all, despite the occasional bafflingly arcane puzzle, this was a mellow little puzzle game that was a joy to play through.

Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045898829', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1643129027}
review: Klocki is a simple puzzle game about connecting shapes and symbols together to form one complete, unbroken figure. It has echoes of the Witness, removing the world and boiling the experience down to a pure puzzle form. You can complete the whole thing in about an hour and it's worth it to play it either all in one shot, or a few levels at a time as a quick distraction. Simple fun!

review: I finished it in about an hour, but I'm pretty analytical. I like the uniqueness of some of the puzzles, which stress your spacial awareness and pattern matching. author: {'steamid': '76561198123127757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1634522113}
review: It's the easiest puzzle game I've played on Steam, which is exactly what I needed for short "brain wipe" breaks between rounds of copyediting. Though simple, the mechanics are clever enough that boredom is kept at bay. The only thing I didn't very much like is the sliders, simply because just moving them around takes more time than your brain needs to solve the puzzle.

review:
Very well designed puzzle game with no instruction apart from simple puzzles to teach you the puzzle language. 

I would compare this to the panels in The Witness. Great fun!

The puzzles get fairly hard though I expected them to get harder, the game is pretty short but great value for the price.

review: This game looks super simple, but extremely fun. The soundtrack, aesthetic, is absolutely perfect for people who love games with a good soundtrack and aesthetic. The sound effect when you click is so pleasing to hear. Very satisfying. And whenever you complete a level, the sound really pays you back for the level you just finished. It sounds amazing. I give a 9.5/10 -0.5 because of the steam achievements. There should be a couple more achievements at least. Having only 1 achievement is great, but could be better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198293242374', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1627578959}
review: I got lost in this game for only a short hour, i am only a few away from beating this game but I have already thought of my review. klocki is one of those games that are worth the small price, if you like a short pleasing puzzle game that isnt that hard to learn i would recommend picking this game up. The puzzles arent the hardest thing if you use your brain and when you think it through but when done correctly can make for a very rewarding experience. I would recommend this game to anyone who likes to sit down and have a calm and relaxing time but at the same time keeping your mind busy. 8/10 a little short and almost perfect.

review:
Had some fun with it, has a nice polish, but nothing amazing on the puzzle designs. The "ending" felt a bit werid too, as nothing indicates you just finished all levels, you just loop back to the first level.

But overall I had some fun and its dirt cheap, so I recommend it, but suggest you maybe try other games from the developer instead (like Hook!) before going to this one

review: Neat and aesthetically pleasing little puzzle game, well worth the money. Thoroughly enjoyed, soundtrack is pleasant as well. There will be frustrating moments, but this is one of those puzzlers that CAN be beaten without referencing guides- especially if you're patient / don't mind the trial and error as new puzzle elements are introduced (the game has no instructions- which I also loved lol).

author: {'steamid': '76561198012988394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1626205019}
review:
Satisfying short puzzle game with no time or move limits. Quite a few mechanics, so the game doesn't get boring. 
Takes about 1-3 hours to finish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078646492', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1625942734}
review:
Really charming little game. The mechanics were not explained but didn't need to be, they were intuitive enough and there was enough variety in them that the game never got grindy, every level had something going for them...
For a seasoned puzzle gamer it never gets that difficult and while it is a bit short (yes, playable through in one hour) it's a fun hour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198402830281', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1625753943}
review:
I rarely write reviews on Steam because most of the times I feel like I have nothing to add that wasn't already said. However, with klocki I just couldn't fight the temptation! The game is actually one of the best, if not the best, puzzle games I've ever played. And although I haven't played many, it still really stands out for me.

klocki takes a minimalistic approach to puzzle games with it simple art and... lack of any sort of menu. The latter is the only issue I really have with this game â€“ it is closed by pressing the "Escape" button, and while it may be a quick and simple way to close a game, many players will press the button expecting it will open a menu, where they could switch the game from full-screen to windowed, for example (turns out that it [i] is [/i] possible to do somehow, but I couldn't figure out how anyway). Levels in klocki are also not numbered, so if you want to replay a specific level you'll have to find it manually by going back one level at a time. The game has one single achievement, and I really appreciate it.

Everything else in klocki I loved. Its puzzles aren't repetitive thanks to several different mechanics presented to a player, and they complement each other well in many levels. I felt myself engaged in completing all the levels and it was very satisfying! The game is easy enough to be fun and relaxing for a casual player like me, but not too easy that there's no challenge at all. I mean, I'm not good at puzzles, and klocki was the first puzzle game that I didn't cheat in by looking up guides for some of the harder levels. And that not only because it's isn't that difficult, but really more because I was intrigued and excited and wanted to do them on my own. Colors and design of klocki deserve their own praise â€“ they're very simple but so pleasing to the eye!

I completed the game in around 90 minutes, which is an appropriate game length, especially for such a low price.

If you haven't already played klocki I can definitely recommend it. Even if you're not that into puzzle games, this one is just pretty, short, and cheap, and it can be a nice introduction to the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172456318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1684995277}
review:
Klocki is a delightful relaxed minimalist puzzle game. 

The game has great pacing and introduces simple and easy to understand mechanics slowly so that when it gets more complicated you are fully prepared for it. 

Another positive is that its levels are short and snappy and really respect your free time and allow you to dip in and out with just one push of the escape button which is really respectful of those of us with little free time.

If you're looking for a gentle puzzle game and are short on time this game is for you.

review: Klocki is satisfying. I find with minimalist puzzles, sometimes it's easy to zone out and keep trying things until you stumble on the right answer, but something about Kocki's mechanics kept me engaged and feeling like I was really working the puzzles out rather than fumbling through them. Very cool. Very short, but it's cheap!

[b][In English] - Translation to help my foreign friends understand.[/b]

[h1]Combination of simplicity and variety[/h1]

It is a puzzle game that the developer re-released after the successful release of 'Hook'.

Although the concept was different, it was a game that made me feel different interests. 
Overall, as you can see from the clean design, it is a simple puzzle game, but in fact there is variety. 
It is a game that solves puzzles by mixing various methods rather than solving puzzles with only one concept.

It is difficult to compare the difficulty with 'Hook', 
but I think it is a good difficulty level to enjoy while solving puzzles lightly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004883087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1623134067}
review:
Once again I'd love to have a neutral opinion button here. If you want a simplistic puzzle game go check out Scalak. It has a better value for your money. 

The game is okay, but stays a bit too simplistic for it's worth. The game ended just when the complexity started to challenge for the first time. I wish there would've been twice the content we have here with the difficulty ramping up for the rest of the levels. I'd be willing to pay multiple times the current price (1â‚¬) for that. Alas, that's not the case here. The music is very simplistic though I didn't manage to burn out on it in the hour I played the game. The sound effects were a bit jarring, especially the swiveling sound. I was about to mute the whole game when it ended just for that hollow drum sound.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021442265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 224, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1617923635}
review:
A short, casual puzzler that revolves around moving and reorienting shapes and lines. You'll get about an hour of it, but that's certainly worth a dollar, especially since it can be replayed after some time passes.

The first twenty or so puzzles are incredibly easy, but keep going since the mechanics ramp up a bit afterwards.

There's no actual interface or puzzle numbering - you're done when you get the only achievement.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960416373', 'num_games_owned': 819, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1617474259}
review:
Great little puzzle game, has about 40 or so puzzles that remain fresh and interesting as the game progresses. Nothing too hard I couldn't handle and I'm no puzzle whiz by any means. Had a satisfying challenge.

Dirt cheap, great chillin music, no reason not to buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282265322', 'num_games_owned': 2191, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1617692779}
review:
8/10 good puzzle game!
pros
- Visuals are nice
-music is calming
cons
-no instructions 
-the shapes at the end are confusing
overall for the price there is no reason to not pick this up if your a puzzle lover!
if you like me and like numbers I always say "a dollar or more per hour is a good deal" and this game takes that almost perfectly. Average time to finish is probably an hour to an hour and a half

author: {'steamid': '76561198115820587', 'num_games_owned': 3074, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1486902751}
review:
Puzzle game. Puisqu'une petite vidÃ©o vaut mieux qu'un long discours et qu'expliquer le fonctionnement de ce jeu est un exercice en soit, je laisse les curieux aller mater le "trailer" du jeu de la page Steam en cliquant sur l'image. Mais en gros, il y a des cases, on les bouges, on les tourne, les intervertis, afin de crÃ©er un chemin de lignes.

Bon, graphiquement, c'est pas la joie. Et l'unique musique, quoique pas dÃ©sagrÃ©able, se contente d'une boucle de 10 secondes environ, mais lÃ  n'est pas lâ€™intÃ©rÃªt du jeu. Plusieurs mÃ©caniques viennent les unes aprÃ¨s les autres au travers des 80 niveaux, histoire de renouveler un peu l'expÃ©rience. Le jeu n'est pas trop difficile, quelques niveaux vont demander au joueur de tÃ¢tonner un peu, mais mÃªme les niveaux "taquin", chose que je dÃ©teste, ne m'ont pas parus compliquÃ©s.

1â‚¬ pour 1h de jeu, pas de menu, pas d'option, pas de carte Steam Ã  farmer, pas de succÃ¨s, ce qui donne un jeu sympa pour combler une dent creuse mais trop peu ambitieux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032700698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1614846122}
review: Short but definitely sweet. A satisfying experience with clean, colorful visuals, fitting sound effects and very relaxing music. Starts out easy but ramps up to a decent challenge without ever feeling completely impossible. Introduces new concepts at a reasonable pace. In short, it's a typical puzzle game, and for a typical puzzle game, it's very well made.

author: {'steamid': '76561198870599331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1613059672}
review:
Relaxing little game. It has several different concepts for you to toy around, but it never becomes difficult. The simple sound effects make solving the puzzles satisfying.

I completed it in an hour. It has several limitations that prevent it from being stretched beyond that; for example, levels are not numbered, and the "level selection" is clunky. Has no level editor. And it does not work full-screen on Linux.

But it is good value for a dollar :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197990286513', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1612795880}

author: {'steamid': '76561198946259505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1692294377}
review:
The game starts out easy (as in, "what the hell is going on here" kind of easy), then increases in complexity until some of the puzzles are quite challenging. I absolutely loved it. Pretty, relaxing, absorbing. It will only take an hour to an hour an a half, but it's worth the pennies it costs.
Two bugbears: you can't play it windowed, so I kept having to close it to check my notifications, and there is no level counter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170332242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1611426968}
review:
A simple and relaxing puzzle game.

I like the clean, uncluttered interface and the lack of menus and instructions - the game mechanics of each new type are easy to work out.

The puzzles range from simple to requiring a bit of thought, and the way that the different elements are combined adds to the interest.

Excellent value, in my opinion.

review:
Very cool puzzle game where you have to match lines and blobs through switching, sliding and rotating pieces and/or platform segments.

Starts out very easy and takes a while to get interesting. There's some good challenge at the end. Could have used a few more levels but not complaining either. Good for its price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965984178', 'num_games_owned': 593, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1608936289}
review:
TL:DR. Not a too complicated nor boring puzzle game with elements of connecting things and mosaic mechanics.

This game is like the ease breeze of spring.
Light colours, mood and mechanics makes for simple and refreshing experience.
The developers have especially truly found the sweet spot of introducing a new element, letting the players experience the mechanic in easy mode, then feeling comfortable with it on a medium difficulty before throwing one into the more mindbuggling puzzles. But never did I experience any levels being too hard nor frustrating :
And new elements kept coming up which prevailed the boredom

[h1]The cube of greatness[/h1]
- Easy shapes and colours for the eyes (though I do not know if there is any mode for the colourblind!)
- A fine stepping curve
- Fair for the price! 
- Quite wellmade for its asking price!
- Suitable for playing on tablet

[h1]The voids of cons[/h1]
- The game was cleared in like 3 hours time (which is maybe a turnoff for some people)
- The rinse and repeat model of: Few levels of introduction to a new mechanic, few medium levels and then 1-2 "hard" ones with the mechanic.... became maybe a bit too predictable (not that it really matters)
- I hate... mosaic puzzles.... but luckily it was somewhat only introduced as a secondary element (but I was close to ragequitting the first time!)
- Maybe too brightful?
- Somewhat maybe too mobile ish of a game (if one hates those kind of games) BUT NO MICROTRANSACTIONS! NOR WAITING TIME

For such a low asking price especially in a bundle with sales. Oh boy, that is value for the buck! Also great for playing on a tablet (I did it through a shadowbox, but I think it should work fine in the steams app... Which means this is an overly wellmade "mobile" game, a heck better than most smartphone/tablet games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035276767', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1671477071}
review:
[b] Achievements. Just the one [/b] 

[h1] The Game[/h1]
Minimalistic puzzle game where you swap tiles to form patterns.

[h1] The Achievements [/h1]
Simply finish all of the levels. Solutions available and can be completed in about 2 hours.

[h1] Recommendation [/h1]
Basic and simple puzzle game. Neutral recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043531488', 'num_games_owned': 1101, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1606823994}
review: klocki is undoubtedly one of the cosiest puzzle games I've played in a long time. The game slowly introduces you to new mechanics throughout the two hour experience, which helps the game remain fresh. For its low price, you get a lot of highly enjoyable, polished content. play it immediately!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041972321', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1606996694}
review:
A quite simple and short game. Don't go into this because you expect tons of content or really difficult puzzles. At its core, this is a way to relax by sliding some blocks around and solving puzzles of a relatively low complexity while listening to soothing sounds. Most levels introduce a tiny new little twist, where existing mechanics are combined in different ways, or new mechanics are introduced. As such, it never gets old.

Its biggest flaw is the lack of a clear indicator on how many levels you have left to go. The minimal interface made me unsure if closing it would save things, so I felt compelled to complete it all at once. But with a total length of 1-2 hours, it isn't the worst shortcoming.

author: {'steamid': '76561199101199002', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1607039274}
review: A terrific little game, simple and not very long but worth every minute. Klocki has a groovy vibe and a medium difficulty level that can be finished in under two hours, and you might want to return to it in bits to solve a puzzle every now and again like I did. Completely worth it for a few dollars spent.

review:
This game is great. I loved playing it during the more drab Zoom lectures we've had during lockdown.
My only knock against it is the lack of settings and accessibility. Some puzzles will be difficult or impossible to colourblind folks.

Otherwise: Good and well designed puzzles. Your parents will like it too!

review:
This is a "puzzle" game in the same sense as a "jigsaw puzzle".  You find "edge pieces" and then look through all the pieces to find more pieces that fit your edge pieces. There is only minimal problem solving, so I would not recommend if you find jigsaw puzzles boring.  

It's also very short,  I completed all the levels in less than 40 minutes.

review:
Klocki (was Ã¼brigens "KLOZKI" ausgesprochen wird, und nicht "KLOKI") ist eines der schÃ¶nsten puzzle Games das es meiner Meinung nach auf der Spieleplattform Steam gibt. FÃ¼r einen Euro bekommt man hier ein super laufendes spiel mit einem schÃ¶nen Soundtrack , und nach drei stunden spielen kann ich sagen das das Geld sich echt lohnt. ich habe es nach drei Stunden geschafft alle Level zu beenden mann kann es aber auch schneller schaffen. Der echt gute Soundtrack sorgt wÃ¤hrend dem spielen fÃ¼r eine echt gute und entspannte Stimmung.
Das Spiel ist zwar schwer/knifflig aber es macht echt SpaÃŸ! die Level werden bis zum ende immer schwieriger aber, man lernt sehr schnell wie man alles in den Level bedient. AuÃŸerdem wird das spiel nie langweilig und echt jeder kann es spielen.
ich empfehle das spiel jedem der nebenbei Gerne knifflige Puzzle spiele spielt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973072467', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1602348060}
review:
klocki is a short and stylish puzzle game. The puzzles gradually increase in complexity. Unfortunately, I found my enjoyment of it to be waning the further I progressed. The core pieces of the puzzles got more annoying to interact with and the puzzles more and more tedious to complete. You go from simple clicking to tapping to swiping to turning and then need to do all of it in the same puzzle. Eventually, I just wanted to be done with it and move on. I didn't feel that the puzzles got any more challenging; the way they are designed you can solve them quite easily with trial-and-error alone never really needing to think. Instead, puzzles simply became more laborious.

Verdict: Not too bad for 99c, but maybe save those for something more engaging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003896212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1602197991}
review:
Very fun little puzzle game. Just like Hook from the same developer, the game never gets extremely hard but does get increasingly interesting. A worthy game to beat in a long session or a couple short ones. 

I do wish these games had volume controls and the option for a dark mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121112670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 278, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1601865976}
review:
Klocki is a simplistic puzzle game where you complete and connect shapes and wires by moving squares around on multiple cubes.  Played using a mouse, beat it in 1.1 hours.  Difficulty is easy to moderate in parts.

Pros

- The concept and how to play are both easy to grasp.  It starts out baby-grade easy and introduces new concepts after every few levels.  

- The whole game is therapeutic.  The music is chill, too.  If your'e stressed out, this is the game for you.

- There's a certain level of fulfillment you'll feel when completing the harder puzzles.  

- There is 1 full achievement to gain.  

- It's one penny less than a Dollar.  $


Cons

- There's no menu and the only way to exit the game (That I've found) is ESC - which takes you straight out the game without any preamble.  Thankfully the game will remember what level you're on when you come back.

- Like the last con, with no menu there's no way to select levels individually.  If you want to play again, you start from the beginning.

- The game is unforgivingly colorful and bright.  It flashes brighter when you match pieces and select tiles, and flashes white when you beat a level.  There's no way to tone it down any.  For light-sensitive people, it'd give you a headache.   The light doesn't blink on and off repeatedly in quick succession or anything.



In the end, Klocki is a simple, super cheap puzzle game that will keep you entertained until you're out of levels.  It feels a little short and I wish there were more levels and a way to tone down the colors, but for the whole 99 cent price tag you'll definitely get what you pay for and then some.  Recommended for the puzzle lovers out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088539629', 'num_games_owned': 1226, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1601702219}
review:
klocki is a fun little puzzle game that leaves you wanting more.

In klocki, your goal is to rearrange the squares in the puzzle so that all the lines either connect up in a loop or end in a proper terminal. It starts off simple, but as you progress further through the game, more mechanics are added on, such as squares that can't be moved but can be rotated, squares that slide around instead of swapping or the ability to move sections of the puzzle around.

The game never gets truly mind-bendingly difficult, but ramps up to a quite fun level, and solving some of the later puzzles is very satisfactory. Unfortunately, the game is also fairly short, and would definitely benefit from having more levels to it. Still highly recommended if you want to kill an hour going through the puzzles though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114798255', 'num_games_owned': 865, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1601746019}

author: {'steamid': '76561198154411534', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1601168379}
review: A simple, minimalist puzzle game that is offered at a cheap price. There's no menu, no instructions, the escape key closes the game (I found out about this by accident when I was trying to bring up a pause menu). In my personal opinion, this game is perfect when you want to take a quick break from whatever you're doing, because you don't have to play until the next checkpoint so you can stop at any time, the puzzles are fairly intuitive so your mind won't go back to this game when it's time to focus on your task at hand (i.e., work or an online class), and its simplicity allows you to relax for a bit.

review:
Great game when you literally don't want to do anything or have nothing to do. It's also pretty chill so you could play it while listening to some music. I need more games like these.

This game could use a night mode since its colors are very bright and that can be very disturbing for some people.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982267489', 'num_games_owned': 1269, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1531949481}
review:
At the price I would have to say its worth it. The game felt a bit to short and repetitive to me, even compared to the other similar games the developer has released.

Its a quick game about connecting lines. I would say that it innovated a little less then Hook.

But at $1 I would say it is worth it, even if it is just a <1 hour long mobile game.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197969056835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1596579248}
review:
Congratulations, Maciej Targoni, to another wonderful small but never little puzzle game with an enjoyable lot of interesting ingame puzzle mechanics. Never becomes boring while it lasts. 

Could have been a little longer, but as all of Targonis are below â‚¬ 1.00 (just as e.g. "Hook"), you will have a lot of fun a small investment.

9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198061022649', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1603697626}
review:
A simple puzzle game with nice ambient music. Some levels take a bit more time to solve, but nothing to complain. Pricing? Well, I've seen more expensive ad-free upgrades in Android games, where you spend half the time watching ads.

PS. "klocki" means "blocks" in Polish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037492679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1596405979}
review:
A relaxing minimalist puzzle progression. Slowly introduces a progression of tile swapping, sliding, and rotating mechanics, alone and then in combination, on 2D and then 3D surfaces.

The goal is always to create one or more complete / closed shapes with no open ends terminating on the edges of tiles. While most levels are simply a gentle twist on what game immediately before, the goal is occasionally ambiguous, or elements (such as turning handles) can be mistaken for being part of the intended track when they are not. A very few of the puzzles are quite challenging, and the penultimate level is a satisfying kind of "boss-fight" puzzle that presents a Frankensteinian combination of all major rearrangement mechanics and shape styles seen throughout the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987657992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 25, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1711564526}
review: Short~ish and minimalist but still casual and relaxing puzzle game. Not that much to say about this. Not too hard but not really challenging either. Puzzles are made pretty well as they contain little to no any "artificial" difficulty like hiding things just for sake of hiding things which usually is just mostly frustrating, not hard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151481586', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1595309360}
review: It was alright, worth $1. Only real gripes are the "minimalistic" (see: annoying) level select menu and the lack of numbered levels (as in you don't know what level number you are on). The fidget toy of gaming, to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198421399626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1595668217}
review:
(Disclaimer: this game can be finished in less than 2 hours. My playtime is longer than that, because I want to earn Steam trading cards to sell them.)
This 'puzzle' game features more than 80 easy puzzles. It's fine for young kids, but for other people, especially puzzle game fans, they're unchallenging and unsatisfying. Even the hardest ones are insults to people's intelligence.
Conclusion: if you are looking for challenge when buying this game, you will be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077161308', 'num_games_owned': 1297, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1594496719}
review:
OIC.

An ultra short simple puzzler that probably doesn't have a steep enough climb and then plateaus when the difficulty does show up. That's not to say you aren't going to get stuck on at least one puzzle. But the first half breezes by in the blink of an eye as the solutions are obvious. Then when the challenge shows up it never ramps up much higher even though new mechanics and twists are added. I think this is due to some mechanics leaving obvious orientation clues. Sure, you go from just swapping tiles on a plane to rotating entire sections of tiles on a side of a three dimensional shape. It seems like your brain should be melting but it holds form. Some of these more complex mechanics have the aforementioned obvious orientation clues though, and as long as you make those moves before sliding, rotating and swapping individual tiles; Well, you're set! You've already reduced the complexity back down to a previous set of rules. Or something like that. Maybe I'm just the dumb monkey who happened to type up Shakespeare. It all just made way too quick of sense to me. Either way, minimalist aesthetic, pretty colors, calm ambient music and an hour killed giving the brain a little wrinkle. All for pennies! Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993148381', 'num_games_owned': 4366, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1594182802}
review: [i]klocki[i] is a minimalist puzzle game based largely around completion of continuous lines within 2D or 3D 'boards' made up of square pieces, using a variety of mechanics including direct exchange of pieces, sliding and rotation. Nicely relaxing, the puzzles start off very straightforward, working effectively to train the player on how each mechanic works without needing even a word of text - but become quite complex by the end. With just over 80 puzzles to complete, there's around 1-2 hours of play time here and little in the way of replay potential - but for its low price, [i]klocki[/i] makes for a satisfying, enjoyable experience while it lasts.

review: Relaxing game about switching and rotating tiles so that lines match up.  Its not mind bending(yet) and its just a nice little thing to (I feel) keep your mind kind of sharp.  I think this one and games like this are money mostly well spent.  Nice peaceful soundtrack also.  Easy interface.  Good range of stages but not a ton.  Not to stressful really at all. I never "got sick of playing it."  Just kind of stopped playing it when I wanted to stop.  I appreciate that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080105348', 'num_games_owned': 1306, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1593868478}
review:
A minimalist puzzle game.

Just like the other puzzle games from this developper : you start with a simple mechanic and get several puzzles using this mechanic, the puzzles get harder and harder... then you get a new mechanic and the puzzles become really easy again to learn to use this mechanic, then it gets harder and harder... then you get puzzles using both of the mechanics you've learned... etc etc...

It's supposed to be relaxing so the puzzles never get too hard even if I personally always start getting annoyed and bored when I reach the last levels ( but that's because I have 0 patience =P ). If you are really stuck on a level, you can always check one of the many guides.

No real menu, pressing esc closes the game, you can't see at what level you are, you can't pick a specific level ( you can just go backward, one by one ).

[b][u]Lifespan :[/u][/b] ~1 hour to finish the 82 levels.

[b][u]Gameplay :[/u][/b] Several things to do :
- You have to connect lines
- Move black squares so that they don't touch each other
- Connect forms
For these, you'll have to use the squares to move part of the lines/forms or black squares.
- Blue squares can be moved freely, switching one with another
- Purple squares have to be moved by sliding them to a free spot
- Blue circles cannot be moved but you can change the direction of the symbol in it
- Yellow circles move parts of the puzzle

[b][u]Achievements :[/u][/b] Just one for finishing all the levels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109607501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 897, 'last_played': 1600466701}
review:
This one's my favorite out of all of Targoni's puzzle games. Simple, understandable visuals, again they do a wonderful job of explaining their mechanics without any words and progress the difficulty smoothly and introduce new mechanics regularily and always build on them. These games are not too long but also not too short. They are challenging, fun and fair.

Excellent brain trainers!

author: {'steamid': '76561198405349966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1606995005}
review:
For less than a euro you will be getting an excellent puzzle game that will start to melt your brain towards the end. There is no dialogue, no explanations, no tutorial. Just you, new puzzles, new mechanics and something to solve. The game itself takes around 1 hour to complete and is mostly pretty relaxing and you will feel challenged later on, but it never gets really unfair.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077646212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1589985737}
review:
Very nice, self-explanatory little logic game.
Expect about an hour-worth of puzzles that don't get monotonous because there's some new mechanics appearing in more or less every 5th level. No menu, no explanations, no text - just you and the puzzles waiting there for you to solve them.
All that for â‚¬1? Definitely a buy if you ask me. I'll make sure to check the other games by M. Targoni.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067938805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1587084397}
review:
Klocki has some simple challenges, and is what I would consider a way to kill some time. It's not extremely difficult as a puzzle, but it's not so simple that just anyone can get it within seconds. It's clean, enjoyable, challenging but not rage inducing, and at that, recommendable. 

For the price too, I'd say it's worth the buy. (Less than a dollar)

author: {'steamid': '76561198011736015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1587566956}
review:
*My reviews do consider the significance of gameplay, story, music, etc. before I assign a score (e.g. walking simulators don't have much emphasis on gameplay, but I wouldn't let that reflect negatively on the individual game being reviewed).

===[Audience]=== â˜Kids â˜‘Everyone â˜Casual players â˜Pro players

===[Graphics]=== â˜Bad â˜OK â˜‘Good â˜Beautiful â˜Masterpiece

===[Gameplay]=== â˜Bad â˜OK â˜‘Good â˜Beautiful â˜Masterpiece

===[Music/Sound]=== â˜Bad â˜OK â˜‘Good â˜Beautiful â˜Masterpiece

===[Price/quality]=== â˜‘Full price â˜Wait for sale â˜Don't do it

===[Requirements]=== â˜‘Minimum â˜Average â˜High end

===[Difficulty]=== â˜Very Easy â˜Easy â˜‘Medium â˜Hard â˜Very Hard

===[Game Time/Length]=== â˜‘Very Short ( 0 - 2 hours) â˜Short ( 2 - 8 hours) â˜Average ( 8 - 12 hours) â˜Long ( 12+ hours) â˜Endless

===[Bugs]=== â˜Game Breaking â˜Many Bugs â˜Few Bugs â˜‘Nothing

===[Others]=== â˜‘Single-player â˜‘Achievements â˜‘Trading Cards

===[Additional Comments]===
An interesting puzzle game that combines sliding blocks and line puzzles with geometry (and towards the end, the geometry gets pretty abstract). The music is relaxing and the puzzles were fun, but the game is pretty short. There are puzzles towards the end where the colors kind of make it difficult to discern what you're supposed to do, but it's easy to work out after toying with them. It took me an hour to finish the game. I would recommend this title.

review:
nice, cool and relaxing game. 80+ lvls, it generally isn't too hard for an adult, but can be very nice stuff presented to a kid. Also - calm music, nice colours and few simple mechanics (I only dislike sliding, but I'm poor at this kind of riddles). 
Cool looking game, got it for very small change, finished it quickly (less than hour), but it was still relaxing fun.

review: While the puzzles sometimes feel a bit more like mere trial and error than really solving it is a pleasant experience on the whole.  Some of the puzzles near the end really get interesting, and I wish the learning curve perhaps hadn't been quite so gentle if it would have meant more of those meaty ones.  Still recommended and fun, if short.  But for its price what else can you demand?

author: {'steamid': '76561197989091200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1581891809}
review:
If you can get this on sale and enjoy visual spacial puzzles you'll enjoy this. Don't expect anything too difficult, you'll finish this in 30-60 minutes.
As someone who likes puzzle games (ranging from the very simple abstract stuff like this, to full productions like Talos Principle), I actually picked this one up because there was a game I had on Windows 3.1 called Klotski (a block slider that had some pretty difficult levels especially for a small kid).
I realized from the screenshots this was not a remake/update of that, but I was still intrigued.

So is this game good? It's fine. Like I said, you'll finish it in 30-60 minutes. I was considering quitting early on because the first 15-20 levels were so simple (no problem solving, just switch all the pieces into an obvious spot without any problems to overcome), I wondered if the whole game was going to be like that. Luckily, things started to change with new mechanics spicing things up.
I'd say this is probably a good game for children, but if you're an adult who enjoys puzzles there are enough non-trivial puzzles to justify the very low cost of this game (low money cost, and short time investment).
If this cost $5 I'd say no way, but I think I got this less for less than a Canadian dollar, so sure.

If you end up getting it, know the dev forgot to include a menu/settings option (just the ability to mute audio, and previous/next level skip): Hold shift when you press play on the steam client to start the game with settings (so you can set it to windowed) -- the game forces full screen and there is no menu to open settings, ESC just exits the game. Annoying, since even games with minimalistic UIs have a clean way to include a basic menu with basic features. The levels also should have been numbered -- just really basic stuff.

review:
Was bekommt man heutzutage denn noch fÃ¼r einen Euro? â€“ [b]Klocki[/b] !
Das RÃ¤tselspiel aus Polen bietet Ã¼ber 80 RÃ¤tsel und Ã¼berzeugt mit einem Stilvollen Design. Bei Klocki mÃ¼ssen WÃ¼rfel (BlÃ¶cke / KlÃ¶tze)  so ausgerichtet werden, dass die Einbuchtungen miteinander verbunden werden und eine durchgehende Verbindung entsteht. Schon nach kurzer Zeit macht sich der Suchteffekt bemerkbar und es kam bei mir Ã¶fter mal vor, dass ich mir sagte â€nur noch ein RÃ¤tsel dann ist Schluss.â€œ Die Gestaltung, Farbgebung und Sounds sind sehr simpel, wirken jedoch immer sehr stimmig. Ganz nach dem Prinzip â€less is moreâ€œ wurde beim Spiel auf jegliche Ã¼berflÃ¼ssige Funktionen verzichtet. Die RÃ¤tsel sind abwechslungsreich und mit ansteigendem Schwierigkeitsgrad sehr motivierend.  [b]Klocki[/b] ist perfekt geeignet fÃ¼r eine ganz entspannte Runde zwischendurch, egal ob viel oder wenig Zeit.
Ich kann Klocki uneingeschrÃ¤nkt empfehlen, da das Spiel in jedes Budget passt und immer eine Runde Wert ist. FÃ¼r Knobelfreunde ein absoluter Pflichtkauf!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001832988', 'num_games_owned': 434, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1686358323}
review:
A good, well-paced minimalistic puzzle game that introduces new gameplay mechanics isolated in their own puzzles before blending them with previously introduced mechanics.  I was worried klocki was going to be trivially easy because of its very gradual increase in difficulty, but it starts feeling like an actual game once the black squares show up, and it ends up genuinely challenging without ever becoming overwhelming.  My heart sank a bit when the game introduced sliding tiles right about when it seemed like it should've been starting to wrap things up, but speaking as someone who would be ecstatic if I never saw another sliding tile puzzle again in my life, klocki's aren't too complicated or bothersome, and I actually found the later puzzles where they mixed them in with other mechanics easier than the ones that focused on sliding tiles alone.

klocki is beautiful in its simplicity, and reminds me of something that would have been in Nintendo's Bit Generations series.  I played through it in its entirety over the course of a slow day at work, and I definitely felt I got more than my money's worth.

review: Very good at teaching mechanics. You get a simple puzzle with a certain mechanic and then you get a few puzzles showing all the different ways you can use those mechanics and how they tie together. Its a very simple game with nice complex puzzles. I love the way it teaches you how to play without any need for narration or instructions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013257244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1575597642}
review:
A wonderfully crafted puzzle game that never frustrates yet always delivers.

The presentation is very clean, simple, and effective, with very soothing music that never gets repetitive or grating. As far as mechanics go, everything can be done with just a point, a click, and a bit of dragging here and there. It does an absolutely wonderful job at introducing new concepts, mixing them together, and gently ramping up the difficulty.

This kind of relaxing, one-screen puzzle game you can play with just a mouse (or touch/pointer device, I suppose) is exactly what I tend to look for when my connection is down, when I don't know what to play, when I'm too tired to play anything more demanding, or when I just want to experience something chill.

My biggest complaint is that it's far too short. It's entirely worth the $1 USD (or less) that you'll get it for, of course -- but once you hit the beautifully satisfying final puzzle, you'll be yearning for more.

I can only hope the developer sees all of the love that people have for this game and takes some time to create some kind of puzzle pack -- for which I would gladly pay.

Puzzle game developers take note -- this one here is a winner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030202379', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1574918424}
review:
I was able to beat this game in about an hour, but I'd still say it was well worth my time. They introduce various new ideas as you go along that keep the puzzles fresh and engaging. So it felt like I spent a lot more time in-game, in a good way.

The visual style is delightful and was a big part of what drew me in. It was a joy to play, and I recommend it to anyone who enjoys puzzles.
