author: {'steamid': '76561198141287530', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1572667162}
review:
Picked this game up on sale and figured it would be a good way to spend an hour or so. With the money I got back off cards and a sale going on when I bought the game, what was there to lose? Turns out there wasn't anything I disliked about the game and it just made the value of it that much better.

There's not much I can say about the game, it does its job as a minimalistic puzzle game. It guides you through some different puzzles and opens up the possibilities of the different colours and different shapes all coming together in the end. One achievement and it isnâ€™t busted makes it great for achievement hunters as well!

Pros:
- Simple
- Easy to play and learn
- Slowly pushes the game at you and its never overwhelming.
Cons:
As much as I liked the game thereâ€™s still some bad things that I found about it in ways.
- A little too simple in its menu. Forward and backwards arrows for level control while nice leaves a little to be desired. Perhaps a level menu would have helped.
- No real way to know youâ€™ve completed the game. Looping back after â€œcompletingâ€ the last level makes you have to wonder if you missed something or not, a little bit of a credits roll would be nice instead of the sudden end.

Overall though, for the low price point and the good puzzles found in the game I definitely recommend it! A solid 8/10 game in my books, and a must for your inventory!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055319056', 'num_games_owned': 503, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1572614372}
review:
Klocki ist ein schÃ¶nes, kurzes aber sehr geiles Puzzlegame.

Das Spielprinzip ist einfach: Mehrere Plattformen welche mit Musterfragmenten versehen sind sollen so positioniert werden, dass das Gesamtbild ein Muster ergibt. 

Das sieht zwar sehr einfach aus, kann aber auch sehr schnell knifflig werden und ich selber bin in manchen Leveln kurz vor der Verzweiflung gestanden. 

Das Spiel macht sehr viel SpaÃŸ und ist fÃ¼r einen Preis von 0,99â‚¬ einfach nur sehr zu empfehlen.

Nun zur Bewertung:
Grafik: 8/10
Soundtrack: 8/10
SpielspaÃŸ: 10/10
Schwierigkeitsgrad: 9/10 
Wiederspielwert: 7/10 [Nach dem Durschspielen hat man zwar alles gesehen, aber es macht trotzdem SpaÃŸ]
----------------
GESAMT: 42/50 

FAZIT: Ein schÃ¶nes, kurzes aber spaÃŸiges Spiel welches sich lohnt es zu kaufen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199392329', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1560461645}
review: If you liked the minimalist game Hook by the same author, then this one is even better. Klocki introduces a few more puzzle mechanics and has a better aesthetic feel to it. For the same price as Hook, yet improved ideas, this game is easy to recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198832675320', 'num_games_owned': 537, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1568237124}
review:
This game starts off really strong, and the first 75% if the game is great. However, towards the end it begins to lose it's way a bit - the puzzles become a confusing mess of shapes without guidance on what you need to do. A good puzzle should be easy to understand but challenging to complete. The game starts out that way but in the last few levels, the aim of the game changes and there's no information on what your new aim is - it's like two puzzle types have been mashed together. It's also quite short.

Overall though, I enjoyed this, and the first three quarters are definitely worth the very low price, so I fully recommend this to people who enjoy puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994336693', 'num_games_owned': 2309, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1565120707}
review:
Playing Klocki is kinda like eating potato chips: every solved puzzle is satisfying and it's hard to stop at just one. The game is perfect for a quick little diversion or a full-on afternoon binge that can be finished in one sitting. Either way, with its lovely understated presentation and diverse puzzle mechanics, Klocki is a good choice for those who enjoy the genre.

[h1]7 / 10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970803173', 'num_games_owned': 2868, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1569187927}
review:
klocki is a really good little puzzle game.
Not too long, but interesting mechanics.
For only 79 pence (UK), it's WELL worth playing!

To be honest, I could have happily played another dozen levels or more!
Congratulations to the devs for making such a great little puzzler.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255156525', 'num_games_owned': 899, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1612364761}
review: Just amazing... This is a game that goes straight to the point, good difficulty and very intituitive. Doesn`t waste time in menues and doesn`t need to say a word. Amazing experience. 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198310800640', 'num_games_owned': 3510, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1574188892}
review:
TL;DR: A must for puzzle lovers, even if easy for the experienced player.

Review written after 1 hour of gameplay, game completed.
My score: 8/10 - one point less for not being too hard, another one for not having more levels.
Pros: Easy to learn, minimalistic but nice graphics and relaxing music, great gameplay.
Cons: Short - game can be completed in 1 hour. It can also be too easy for some players.

Abstract: Klocki is a spatial puzzle with wonderful background music, another game in the same vein of the rest of the Relaxing Puzzle Box bundle. It has simple but not plain silly graphics, rather pretty and functional, varied mechanics, and not a single word of how to play the game - learning the mechanics and rules is part of the gameplay. And it's relaxing: no timers, movement count, achievements to get here and there by having to repeat the same level until perfected. Instead of that, just relaxing game, focused into solving the levels peacefully without worrying about anything else.

Graphics: 7/10 - While the graphics are simple, they don't need more. The animations are smooth, everything is in shaded 3D isometric surfaces, and again, while being simple, they're nice graphics.

Sounds: 9/10 - Ambience relaxing background music, and minimal & elegant sounds. A little variety on the music would have made the sound department just perfect.

Gameplay: 8/10 - The basic of the game is to slide, rotate or swap tiles, located on the three planes of isometric surfaces, to satisfy certain required rules. For example, lines must have a beginning and an end; black squares can't touch other black squares; colours must match. How to achieve that, and what pieces and mechanics are available depend on the level. In some you can't swap, but you can rotate and slide; in others you have limited swapping and group rotation, etc. What must be achieved and how, is for you to discover, and that is a good part of the gameplay.

I don't think I'm specially good with 3D spatial puzzles, although I tend to be better in them than other kind of puzzles; that said, I found the game quite easy, with rarely getting stuck for more than a few moments to complete a level. Easy with 81 levels (more or less, maybe I counted wrong) makes the game too short, specially after such a good time playing it. And that's my only 'but' in the gameplay. Other than that, it's a really nice game to play. The rules are easily understood by a gradual introduction of new elements and mechanics, making the difficulty progression really smooth. And when you thought you've seen it all, new pieces or a different rule come into play.

UX: 9/10 - It's an excellent user experience, that not many games can provide with so few elements. The game felt very nice from beginning to end. The UI is totally barebones, with just the needed elements and nothing else. Not a single word, just four icons and the gameplay. Controlled only with mouse - click or drag, without any complications. So, exceedingly simple, but nothing else is required. Near perfection.

Special stuff: Have I mentioned it's short? The game has little replayability value, maybe after a long hiatus but it'll be even easier then, unless you have a reset button for forgetting how to play a game. 81 Levels are just too little, and often I found frustrating that once a certain mechanic was being mastered and ready to expand on difficulty, it moved forward to new mechanics. While the game is great and I enjoyed it so much, I feel it has more potential.

Warnings: 81 levels.

Summary: Polished, three-dimensional spatial puzzle that you will probably enjoy if you like puzzles; including if you make it in 1 hour like I did (57 minutes). One of the puzzle games I've liked the most in a long long time. I strongly recommend it, with or without a sale; I got it with the Relaxing Puzzle Box bundle and I don't regret that purchase, so you might want to look into the bundle if you think this kind of game is your cup of tea.

I would buy a Klocki Extended with 100 more levels!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995384957', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1564258093}
review: A great brain-bender that took me just over an hour to complete. Certainly not overly easy or overly hard, and the puzzles ramp up in difficulty as you progress. There is also a nice variety of puzzle types to learn how to beat. A well-spent $1 in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075820042', 'num_games_owned': 3556, 'num_reviews': 454, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1563904731}
review:
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/38287655-Prof.Vaharrak/]Prof.Vaharrak's Curator Group - Almost 30 years of gaming experience at your service[/url]

This guy makes great minimalist, relaxing puzzle games.

In Klocki you move tiles around or rotate them to connect lines, patterns, colors and what not. Difficulty increases when new 'tiles' come into play: rotating tiles, tiles you can only slide, etc.

Despite sounding simple, it's good, not overly complicated, and well worth a buck to play if you're into puzzle games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048294572', 'num_games_owned': 3102, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1666889953}
review:
To be honest, I'm quite impressed with [b]klocki[/b]. Well surpassed my expectations of some more or less trivial puzzle game.

[b]klocki[/b] talks to you with lines, shapes and colors - exactly what our brain "sees" first.

New mechanics are introduced the right way: from the very simplest examples that you yet have to solve by yourself to gradualy harder puzzles where new mechanics blend with already learned old ones.

Clean distraction-free visuals, minor audio-visual feedback on each action and ambient music create zen-like puzzle experience. 

[quote]
I can highly recommend [b]klocki[/b] to anybody.
I salute its creators Maciej Targoni and Wojciech Wasiak \0/
[/quote]

---

P.S. Minor technical side note: if you run it on Linux - go with windowed mode. At least that's what I had to do so that the game registered my input. Judging by a forum thread ( https://steamcommunity.com/app/499440/discussions/0/1333474229073725380/ ) - it's a common issue (that was promised to be fixed). I'm closing my eyes on that.

Played on Arch Linux + KDE (with i3 as window manager).

author: {'steamid': '76561198025171943', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1562126783}
review:
Extremely clean visuals. Competent but unmemorable audio. Probably best played with a touchscreen. Takes its minimalist ethos to an impractical extreme by restricting the player's in-game options to "sound on or off". (By holding Shift when opening the game, a launcher will appear that at least allows you to adjust resolution and enable/disable fullscreen. Why this doesn't appear by default on first run is a headscratcher.)
Then againâ€”while I enjoyed its puzzles, the game is short and simple to the point of ephemerality. You probably won't need to launch it twice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198847240481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1577749871}
review:
I bought Klocki in a puzzle game bundle and boy howdy is it cute. There aren't menus, you're just thrown into the game as soon as you launch it and you close it by pressing Esc. In the upper left is your "menu", a toggle circle which amounts to level selection and muting the game. 
Word of warning, the game is pretty loud so make sure you have your speakers not at 100% like I did when I first launched it. 
Aside from that small gripe, the music is nice and the puzzles take some thought to solve without being unfair or too demanding. I love the pastels of the game and I can definitely say that I'll use the it to calm myself in the future. 
It is absolutely worth its price and then some.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064860197', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1561647616}
review:
This is a great little puzzle game. The puzzles are not too challenging, but very satisfying to solve. I espescially like the way new puzzle mechanics are slowly introduced. 

Every mechanic is first introduced with an easy puzzle and evolves in later puzzles. However, even the more complex puzzles never make you feel overwhelmed. New mechanics are introduced in a rapid pace, which made me feel that the game could have contained more puzzles building upon the the existing mechanics. Whenever a new mechanic was introduced I always thought: "oh damn already? I expected more puzzles exploiting this mechanic." This is a positive on the one hand because I wanted more, but could also be a criticism on the length of the game. However, for â‚¬ 0,99 you can't really go wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074941010', 'num_games_owned': 8771, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1561594568}
review:
Starts off really easy then difficulty goes up and up and up. This was great as it constantly hits you with new challenging puzzles and once you actually figure them out, it's really satisfying. As soon as you start getting used to how a puzzle works it will throw a new idea at you and then once you learn about that one, it's gonna combine them, to test you on both. They're not impossible puzzles and it's not something you wouldn't be able to figure out yourself either so it's great if you want to test yourself here and there and keep your brain active.

If you're someone looking for a really difficult puzzle game to play, this might be a little easy for you. It has a few less than 100 levels and they can all be finished by most average players in around 1-3 hours. However for $1 there is nothing to lose to try it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026007314', 'num_games_owned': 486, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1524889944}
review: I really like these cute minimalist-style puzzle games. It introduces new concepts slowly, in a way where you learn by experimenting, rather than having to read help text. The levels progress in difficulty at a comfortable pace. Some people complain when games are "short", but I honestly enjoy the satisfaction of short-but-sweet completion for games like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078230699', 'num_games_owned': 1392, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1561511202}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001494272', 'num_games_owned': 1309, 'num_reviews': 335, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1561513172}
review: klocki has some interesting ideas, but it's a bit too minimal. The controls can be unclear at times, and sliding tiles doesn't flow very well with a mouse. It's reasonable to complete in an hour, as most puzzles aren't too hard. The sliding puzzles bothered me most, just because it's tedious to reach the solution once you already solve it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007513026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 433, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1561243029}
review:
Simple yet fun puzzle game. Unfortunately it seems you can't skip a level so if you are stuck on a level you are stuck on the game. Further, there are no level numbers so getting a solution to a level you are stuck on is annoying.

I found the levels for approximately the first half of the game to be fairly easy and enjoyable. Then they started to get frustrating to complete and the rules, which you have to infer, are obscure. For a few levels I could only solve them by random clicking. I gave after completing about 2/3 of the levels because the game wasn't fun anymore.

For the money, it is reasonable value. However, I'm a completionist, I like to finish games that I start - so I didn't like the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198400811866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1576841570}

author: {'steamid': '76561198219343843', 'num_games_owned': 16124, 'num_reviews': 312, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1558913539}
review:
[b]klocki[/b] proudly wears its minimalist tag by not including a single word of text in the game. From launch to finish, it's nothing but puzzles. Discover by trial and error how to connect its various broken circuits across a couple dozen stages. The color choice is complemented well by its relaxing soundtrack. An easy recommendation for puzzle fans.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+ Polished design
+ Ease of play, one mouse button control
+ Logical progression, mechanics introduced before increasing complexity
+ The color choice and line variations make this accessible even for the colorblind
+ Soothing music, never intrusive
+ Suitable for all ages

[h1]Cons[/h1]
All are minor complaints:
- The lack of menu means manually clicking backward through every puzzle
- No level numbering
- No resolution or window options. (Actually hidden, press shift when starting the game)
- Exiting the game is Esc, which is intuitive for most, but doesn't tell you anywhere.
- Game loops on completion without any on-screen message, you might wonder if you missed something
- No stage reset button (but you can click back to previous puzzle to do this)
- 30~60 minute length, little reason to replay.

All in all, good value for its low price.

[u]Achievement Hunters[/u]: Only one completion achievement. Get to the last stage, with green and red hearts. No need to complete it.

review: A great short puzzle game that you should definitely play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035329946', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1558419899}
review:
I wish there was a neutral recommendation. It isn't a bad game... just toward the end it gets more annoying than hard.  No frustration involved, just, too many mechanics doesn't make the puzzle harder, just the pieces harder to move around.   I liked Hook a lot better.

This games interface was a lot less polished, too.  There was no obvious way to tell you had done all the levels, it just cycled back to the first.  Unlike hook, this one could have benefited from at least a menu showing how many puzzles there were. I found myself wanting to quit toward the end, but not really wanting to give up, and it would have helped knowing how many were left... maybe a number?  Again, not really a need, more a result of the game getting tiring after a while.

Aside from the ability to hold my attention, there really isn't anything wrong with the game to NOT recommend it. The game is finished, bug-free, kind of simple graphics, and not that complicated.  Skillful programming, relaxing music.  A lot about the game is pretty cool. Just... altogether didn't hold my attention toward the end like Hook did.  Still worth buying on sale.  I bought as part of a bundle and don't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126070810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1558965997}
review:
I love puzzle games such as this and I found klocki to be fun and interesting.  A couple of the middle to late levels had me going "ok this feels strangely random" but I still enjoyed them nonetheless.

The game doesn't hold your hand per se, but it moves slowly enough at first for you to easily figure out what it wants you to do.  Worth the low price for a couple hours of calming enjoyment!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065753865', 'num_games_owned': 872, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1556134297}
review:
klocki is the second game from Maciej Targoni, with the first being Hook and you could basically say that they are both minimalistic, relaxful, and peaceful puzzle games.

klocki gives you a ton of puzzles (about 20 or so more than Hook) and with that they introduce a ton of new, but simple mechanics and this is definitely a good thing, but I also find this to be a somewhat bad thing. A lot of times in this game it seems to focus on new mechanics and mixing them and while that is good it also gets repetitive and tedious at times to complete them as it will give you a couple levels or so without really changing the format of a group of levels. Overall it's still a really good experience, but not as good as Hook imo. 

The game is graphically way superior than Hook, it seems like they actually wanted to give the game some actual looks as opposed to some minimalistic white background with the wires and hooks and the soundtrack is good too, but I don't feel like it's actually existent at times though and the sound effects are pretty nice too. The game definitely puts you in a relaxful environment and sure the game does get tedious and repetitive it also helps when you have a nice atmosphere to not feel like this all the time.

Do I recommend klocki? It's a hard yes and while I don't think the experience is as good as Hook it is still a fun group of puzzles if you like Maciej Targoni's previous title or any of his titles. I'd say it's definitely worth the 99 cents to get it, or if you're like me you could also buy it through the Relaxing Puzzle Box bundle to also get some of Targoni's other titles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080083782', 'num_games_owned': 1442, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1556182976}
review: If you liked the minimalist game Hook by the same author, then this one is even better.  Klocki introduces a few more puzzle mechanics and has a better aesthetic feel to it.  For the same price as Hook, yet improved ideas, this game is easy to recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067083986', 'num_games_owned': 3478, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1554080149}
review:
I'm a fan of minimal puzzle games, and this is one of the best ones I've tried. Unlike most of its brethren, which tend to be focus on one core mechanism, klocki really shines when it forces you to combine multiple mechanisms, always keeping the player on his or her toes, always delivering curveballs. 

I'd say the puzzles vary from easy to intermediate, I didn't have to spend more than 2 minutes on any given puzzle. If you're looking for hardcore difficulty, look elsewhere, but this was a thoroughly enjoyable 2-hour experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198435241829', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1558804808}
review: A deceptively simple puzzle game with relaxing music and excellent design. This is certainly worth a quick playthrough to test your logic, especially considering the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014927331', 'num_games_owned': 708, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1554937055}
review: This is some good stuff. What's not to like? Very inexpensive, nice ambient soundtrack, the puzzles keep evolving so they never get stale. It's short which means you can just occasionally boot it up, play a few puzzles, then come back to it the next day if you want to. Very relaxing and well designed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128285760', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1553722792}
review:
Connect lines, rotate surfaces, create beatiful shapes. All while listening to relaxing music. While never extremely hard (some of the puzzle solutions feel simple enough) there are some very interesting head-scratchers and as you proceed through the 82 different levels, the game will keep throwing you new original mechanics and ideas, then combining them and putting your skills to the test. It stars quite simple and all too easy, but soon the game gets more complex but never frustrating. There is always a moment when you see a new puzzle and you go "ooh!" and then once you figure out the solution you go "aha!"

Short game but beautiful.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989273094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1552651558}
review:
Klocki is a very enjoyable relaxed puzzler.

Mechanics, though not highly complex, are reasonably varied and enjoyable. Graphics can be obnoxious when one gets to the area fill mechanic (ovals, hearts, circles etc.) -- I found the colour pallet to be harsh on the eyes.

Puzzle value is decent but, as with almost all casual puzzlers, replay value is limited as there is only one solution per puzzle.

Definitely worth a buy when on sale or as part of a puzzle bundle. Graphical pallet selection is poor, as mentioned but this title is engaging enough to be worth considering at full price as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021996469', 'num_games_owned': 816, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1551405330}
review:
A surprisingly genius puzzle game. It starts off extremely basic, yet keeps introducing more and more concepts that intertwine to make for a highly engaging experience. There is no written guidance, you are given a puzzle and expected to solve it, but this is not a negative as all the mechanics are simply figured out with basic queues.

The puzzles never get particularly and I do wish there had been more, but for what you pay I would happily recommend this to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046486409', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1552426163}
review: Je suis un peu partagÃ© sur le fait de le recommander ou pas. Je pense que le seul aspect nÃ©gatif au jeu, c'est qu'il faut aligner des piÃ¨ces pour constituer un puzzle, et que pour certains niveaux, le puzzle ne ressemble Ã  rien du tout. L'alignement des piÃ¨ces de certains niveaux sont illogiques, c'est assez frustrant parce que le puzzle doit ressembler Ã  quelque chose au final, mais c'est pas le cas pour 25% des niveaux. On obtient des figures qui sont moches, disproportionnÃ©es. Pour moi il y a pas assez eu de recherches dans la construction des puzzles. Ce n'est pas et ce ne sera jamais le meilleur jeu puzzle Steam. Pour 1â‚¬ il est prÃ©fÃ©rable de les mettre dans un autre jeu clairement. Je crois que je l'ai achetÃ© pendant les promotions Ã  -25% donc tant mieux pour moi, je n'aurais pas mis plus de 75 centimes dans ce jeu. Mais dans l'aspect global je le recommande quand mÃªme parce qu'il y a pire comme jeu puzzle et que le systÃ¨me est assez original malgrÃ© le fait que certains niveaux soient trÃ¨s trÃ¨s moches. Il reste assez court comme jeu (seulement 2h). Je mets la note de 5/10

review: These guys make the best puzzle games. So relaxing and so helpful if you need to clear your mind. Honestly, if you're ever stuck with some bad thoughts, these games always help calm and relax me. I love them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063154440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1547366364}
review:
[h1]Klocki's Puzzling Paths[/h1]

Klocki is a mechanically simple but highly engaging puzzle game elevated by its minimalist presentation and sheer creativity. Every few levels new mechanics are introduced and layered upon existing ones to keep things fresh. Definitely grab this if you enjoy turning visual chaos into visual order.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995630835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1546166841}
review: A very good puzzle game, with a lot of variety.  It's quite clever in how it feels simple, but really isn't.  It's hard, but no puzzle will be so hard that you'll want to rage quit.  Definitely worth the price!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080387397', 'num_games_owned': 1282, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1546116786}
review: This is a decent, short puzzle game. I beat it in less than an hour. The puzzles are trivial to solve for about the first half of the game, and then they finally make you think a bit. The game only has one achievement, so it won't mess up your stats if you only play it partway; it's all or nothing.

review: I get that this is only a dollar.  I get that.  But this took less than an hour to beat.  I'd gladly pay for some extra level packs, because this is just way too short. review:
Pros: A complex yet simple puzzle game that is quite the self-teacher for a causal gamer like me. Relaxing, wholesome, tenderhearted, is able to hug you after a long rubbish day at the office and make you feel appreciated and needed no one else does. 

Cons; Does not pick up their sweaty gym clothes after a workout, making the whole bathroom smell like musky body odor.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971275585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1543452017}
review: A relatively short (it took me under an hour) but generally fun puzzle game. I think that this game loses a lot of points for me personally when it introduces [spoiler] slide puzzles [/spoiler] later in the game as I absolutely despise this type of puzzle and think it detracts from the game. Thankfully there aren't a ton of puzzles that use this mechanic, but since there aren't a massive number to begin with these really feel like a slog and aren't fun at all. Overall the game is good but using that specific type of puzzle kills it for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259789863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1542009443}
review: I'd buy this for a dollar! ... Wait, I did. Anyway, this is a fun puzzle game from the guy responsible for Hook. Starts off easy, with the levels getting progressively more challenging. There's no menu, which is a little odd; the puzzles themselves are fairly intuitive. All in all, a fun little game/distraction for the price. I lost count, but I think there were approximately 80 levels. I left the game open and played while I worked on some freelance assignments; even still, I beat every level in a little under three hours. Would recommend for anyone who enjoys puzzles/is in need of a distraction that will stimulate your brain.

review: A fun little puzzler that will probably have you thinking about finishing it if you have to quit before you've completed all the puzzles.  A good number of puzzles for the price, and it does a nice job of introducing new mechanics every few puzzles, so it never really seems to get stale or overstay its welcome at all.  Definitely worth the purchase price.

review:

Has a nice calming atmosphere thanks to the music and various sounds. The colors are also nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026124098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1538346082}
review: klocki is fun filled puzzle games that I have had so much fun playing. And for those that enjoy fun, enticing brain consuming games, that start of easy and have a hard finish, then games made by Maciej Targoni are right up your alley. This particularly one is to try and keep lines in a chain or to try and get the object centers to all be connected correctly. It makes it harder by having blocks that turn the whole side around or only individual blocks. All and all the puzzle game that I thought was well worth its price!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048817935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1530733053}
review:
Klocki nasce come gioco su Android realizzato da un ragazzo, un tale Maciej Targoni, creatore anche di Hook (altro puzzle game).
In klocki il giocatore deve sistemare correttamente dei tasselli disordinati secondo una determinata logica, ovvero comporre delle linee. Ãˆ piÃ¹ difficile da spiegare che provare in prima persona, il gioco in realtÃ  Ã¨ molto intuitivo e pur non essendoci tutorial, bastano pochi click per capire il funzionamento.

Si tratta di un piacevole passatempo dalla durata di uno-due orette e adatto a chi apprezza i puzzle originali, con un buon prezzo (consiglio di prenderlo nel bundle "ufficiale" su Steam).

author: {'steamid': '76561198057690806', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1536779180}
review:
This game is reasonably priced and does what the creator wanted, which is to be a relaxing game. I was never stressed out during my playtime and every different puzzle type was explained with a few levels before the difficulty increased. 
I personally found the puzzles near the end were my favorites, as they incorporated multiple elements from earlier in the game. 
I'd also give credit to how easy the game plays and how if you are patient enough with any level you will eventually understand what you need to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044295712', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1534718687}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035182410', 'num_games_owned': 1144, 'num_reviews': 372, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1527766176}
review:
The story, I made up in my head about this game, would be that aliens try to teach humans their language by making them solve these puzzles. Because at first you start out creating shapes who are completely alien to you but as you go forth your brain reshapes to the needs of the puzzles. 

Considering klocki is the only one out of these small puzzle games that made me write basically fanfic about it, it's probably the best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049020554', 'num_games_owned': 4131, 'num_reviews': 374, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1534825671}
review:
klocki is a short (I beat the game in 56 mins), but entertaining puzzle game that employs a minimlistic style to it. The game has a couple of different types of levels, with the type of puzzle required changing. Most of it involved connecting lines or blocks together in order to form a non-broken line or pattern. You can do this by moving blocks, turning it, turning the whole platform, etc. in order to get it to connect. The game really does a good job of making the levels seem intimidating, but at the same time plausible and solvable. This game is the definition of simple but good. The only gripe is that it is a bit short and lacks a menu (the game just restarted after I beat it).

Overall, great simple game that only costs you only a single dollar (99 cents to be exact).

Rating: 8.5/10
Recommend Price: $0.99 (full price is worth)

author: {'steamid': '76561198052332539', 'num_games_owned': 976, 'num_reviews': 335, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1534636959}
review:
Ich hatte zuerst den Nachfolger Scalak entdeckt und gespielt und war davon so begeistert, dass ich mir im Anschluss sofort klocki zugelegt habe. Auch hier wurde ich nicht enttÃ¤uscht.

Ebenso wie in Scalak fÃ¤ngt man auch hier klein an, um die einzelnen Mechaniken erst einmal einzeln kennenzulernen, bevor diese dann in umfangreicheren Puzzles miteinander kombiniert werden. Dadurch werden die einzelnen Level zunehmend komplexer und herausfordernder. Dennoch kommt keinerlei Frust auf. Alle Level sind mit ein wenig Geduld wirklich machbar.

Dieses kleine aber feine Puzzle-Spiel macht so unglaublich viel SpaÃŸ. Auch fÃ¼r diese "Perle" gibt es deshalb eine klare Kaufempfehlung und ein fettes Daumen hoch!

author: {'steamid': '76561198388538187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1650402212}

author: {'steamid': '76561198287805607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1533520708}
review:
A close friend purchased this game for me, as we were in a very serious war of gifting each other cheap games back and worth. He purchased this on discount, I believe 86cents. Jokes on him, I adore puzzle games. 

This game doesn't take long at all to complete, and teaches you the mechanics of the game in a very easy to comprehend way, without even needing words or a tutorial to do so. I wouldn't say any puzzle in here is too difficult, though it is satisfying to complete each one. The later levels with the abstract orbs gets a bit ehhhh, since even when you complete it it mostly feels like "But why is that even right?" Since the abstract ones don't form any cohesive formation, unlike everything else. 

Pleasing artwork and soundtrack, one achievement (complete all puzzles), and can be fully completed in one sitting. Can recommend, on sale or not. Was a very enjoyable time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136781337', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1666471935}
review: Amazing, smooth, relaxing game but still challenging enough to want me to come back everyday. Would reccomend for anyone who wants to get their brain working before school or work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198223164124', 'num_games_owned': 946, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1533568200}
review:
klocki is a flawless puzzle game that will grant you hours of relaxing fun.

The graphics and interface are perfect, and the music sets a relaxing and peaceful mood.

The core principle is always the same: move or rotate the pieces around to form closed circuits or shapes. Things start simple, but when you think you have mastered a technique, the game throws you another challenge. klocki neither ever becomes too boringly easy, nor ever too frustratingly hard.

While some might say klocki could benefit from some extra levels or challenges, i felt it ended exactly when it should, refraining from denying me the satisfaction of finishing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075875878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1571821131}
review:
It's pretty relaxing to play and I had a good time with it! And though parts of it are challenging, it slowly builds up to that. With no time or turn limit (at least, that I know of) it's pretty fun to tinker with even when it takes a while to complete the levels!

The graphics are also very clean and appealing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198126809623', 'num_games_owned': 542, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1530992307}
review: It's one of a few well made minimalist puzzle games. There's a free Flash version online that has some of the the mechanics, so you can play that for a bit to decide whether this is the kind of game for you. I got through all 82 levels in about 45 minutes (played longer to get the trading cards), and the last few combine every mechanic in the game to provide some very challenging puzzles, but not so challenging that novices will be turned off from them. Give this one a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196781194', 'num_games_owned': 857, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1584984663}
review: One of the many great original minimalist puzzle games on Steam. It can take up to three hours to reach the end and it has a lot of replay value because it will be a long time before you memorize the solution to each puzzle. It starts out easy, but gets harder and it changes up the mechanics every few levels or so, this prevents the game from ever getting stale. It teaches you how to play the game without tutorials or instructions. Simple to understand, yet challenging to beat. This game is smart and it makes gamers feel smart too.  For only $1, it's definitely worth having in your collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220081212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1530463949}
review:
Simplistic mechanics but interesting game. Bought for 20% off in the sale, would happily have paid full price.

Despite there being no text/instructions, the mechanics are very easy to pick up and are introduced gradually, and then slowly combined to make for a decent learning curve. I enjoyed this a lot - some moments to make you think once multiple mechanics are involved in the same level but nothing that took much more than a minute or two's thought. Hour and a half playtime includes full completion, messing around trying to see if any menu options, and wandering off to make/eat a sandwich halfway through.

Pros:
Simple, easily understood mechanics.
No text, so perfect for any language.
Suitable for wide ranges of ages.
Background music/sound effects unobtrusive but clearly indicate success (and can be turned off).
Simple but pleasing graphics/colours.
Decent learning curve.
Doesn't feel repetitive.


Cons
There's no level reset as far as I can see, but I don't think you can actually get to a point where you're irretrievably stuck.
Not really sure about replay value, perhaps after a couple of months have passed?
No level select - once you've completed all levels you can click through them in sequence, but you can't go directly to the one you want.
More levels would be nice. (No idea how many there actually were - felt a little on the short side, but not too bad given the price point).

review: I think 1 Euro (0,79 now because of the sale) for a calm and relaxing game is more than fair. I loved the atmosphere and the puzzles of course. Most of them are easy or not too hard, but there were few which gave me a pleasent brain-numbing experience. Gametime could be 1-2 hours, so I was satisfied at the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001808110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1529718387}
review:
Play time is the time I took to beat it +~20 minutes.
It's a short game with rather light difficulty but it introduces new concepts constantly so the puzzles don't really get stale. 
At this price it's really hard to complain about the lenght. A puzzle game that overstays its welcome leaves you with a bad taste. I felt this one explored its mechanics to completion and ended right there, as it should.
5/5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176034347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1543409187}
review: A short game. The small price seems fair, since it's possible to play the game as flash for free, just with a bit worse visiuals. One thing I like, that may not appeal to some people is the minimalistic menu. At least for me it was easy to figure out. This game has the potential for community levels, which i doubt will be added, since the dev would have to make an intuitive level maker. Still, it woild be nice to see something like that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024434868', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1529501633}
review:
This is one of those puzzle games which makes you think out of the box by gradually increasing the difficulty by showing you new mechanics which you later have to coperate to find and make patterns. 

Pros :

- Relaxing and smooth gameplay
- Easy to 100% 
- Easy but not THAT easy either. Some puzzles were tough.
- Cheap

Cons :

- Only bad point that I have is the fact that to change the resolution you need to hold down the "Shift"-key while launching the game. This should be added as a feature in game when you press the ESC button. Nothing major but still quite annoying when it launched in fullscreen mode.

Overall :

A short and sweet puzzlegame which I find is worth the pricetag. It's also an easy game to complete for achievementhunters so yes, I recommend this game fully! //VincentMusic

author: {'steamid': '76561198101454711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1529266099}
review:
[h1]About the game :[/h1]

klocki is a small size small price puzzle game.

[h1]What I like :[/h1]

Gameplay - Simple and challenging gameplay by arranging tiles to make lines or dots at first. Then in the later levels, the game add the element of spinning the tiles and sliding puzzle.

Steam Trading Cards - The game drops cards.

Soundtrack - The music is relaxed. It perfectly fits with the gameplay and visual styles.

Pricing - The price is reasonable.

[h1]What I dislike :[/h1]

User Interface - It is not friendly to user. It does not display how many levels are.

[h1]Conclusion :[/h1]

The game is like a small exercise for thinking and solving puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1528989229}
review:
Klocki is a simple, minimalist, casual puzzle game.    Arranging tiles like dominoes to makelines or dots.  In later levels, the tiles spin instead of being dragged and dropped.

As far as puzzle games go, it's one of the better ones, but the entire game could easily be done in Flash in a web browser.

As common sense guidelines tell us, if it can be done in a web browser, it doesn't belong on Steam.

That. was. awesome.

Here's a short, but very well crafted puzzle game.  

It starts off easy and ramps up with lots of variables added in as you go along.

Must have MOOOOOOORE!

Well worth what I paid ( 95 cents NZ )

author: {'steamid': '76561198076721797', 'num_games_owned': 915, 'num_reviews': 778, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1606078897}
review: Short and simple but it gets at least decently interesting by the time the game ends - which took me under 40 minutes front to back, but, it was enganging enough at the very least. I feel like the game could've done more to combine its different elements in interesting ways - the game introduces mechanics in waves and then only ever unites them for a small few number of puzzles near the end, I would've preferred a more gradual buildup of ideas instead of the way the game presents them all separately without uniting them, though this is a trend I've noticed with the developer's games in general, though their latest seems to have resolved that to some extent at the very least. But yeah, short but satisfying little puzzle game, not a ton else to say.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008543369', 'num_games_owned': 895, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1558977813}
review:
I'm obviously in the minority with my review, and honestly I would give klocki a neutral rating. But since it's not an option, I give it a thumbs down just as a warning for hardcore puzzle fans.

At it's very basis, kocki is a good puzzle game: it builds the puzzles smartly, you have to figure out the rules, which are introduced gradually. But ultimately it fails to live up to expectations: it's way too simple, the puzzles are straightforward, there are no dead ends, you never ask yourself what to do next.
It's a relaxing, simple put-the-pieces-in-their-desired-place game, not a real headcracker - if you're looking for the former, then give it a shot, otherwise avoid.

review:
Played a few levels every morning at the crack of dawn with my coffee, until I beat it in a few days.

Has to be one of the most soothing puzzle games I've tried, and I have quite a few on my account. I finished it a bit sooner than expected and would love some sequels. :)

11/10, most chill and enjoyable puzzle game I've ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198825367832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1523883502}
review: One of my favourite puzzle games, ever. Without explanation, it eases you in with the simplest imaginable problem: swap two pieces by clicking on them. As you progress through the puzzles, more and more elements are revealed: tiles that change colour and shape depending on whether they're touching or not, levers that rotate parts of the game board, tiles that can only be swapped, that can only be slid, that can only be rotated. Eventually you're confronted with problems that use four or five elements in ways that are truly confounding. It's never cruelly difficult, and sometimes if you're baffled you can chance upon a solution unexpectedly just by plugging away at it. It's a lovely, relaxing mental workout.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000797503', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1551110710}
review:
Es un juego de concepciÃ³n y ejecuciÃ³n muy simple: puzzles de conectar lÃ­neas.
No tiene ningÃºn tutorial y tal vez hiciera falta para entender algÃºn mecanismo, aunque experimentando un poco se puede llegar a entender el funcionamiento todo sin problema.
El nÃºmero de niveles es algo escaso y la dificultad, aunque va en lÃ³gico aumento, no es muy elevada. Yo lo he terminado en menos de hora y media, contando con que lo he dejado abierto mientras hablaba un ratito por el mÃ³vil.
Intenta ser un juego para desconectar de los estudios o del trabajo, hacer unos niveles escuchando mÃºsica y vuelta a la rutina. En ese sentido, y viendo que no vale ni 1â‚¬ (yo lo pillÃ© por menos todavÃ­a con oferta) no estÃ¡ nada mal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096742168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1590404651}
review: Puzzles puzzles everywhere. This one kept me busy. I like those little old slider puzzles where you re-arrange the tiles to fit the picturte. This reminds me of those for sure. It even loosely reminds me of Pipe Dream, one of my all time favorite games that I haven't played in many years. If you want some new puzzles and have some spare change this game is as good as any. I tend to scoop games like these up on sale at least once a month to keep the puzzles fresh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085786159', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1519197800}
review:
Klocki is a small but fun and interesting puzzle game.
It only took me a bit over an hour to completely finish (not enough to get all the cards, even), but despite this it's pretty well worth the money, mostly because its not that expensive.
It also introduces new mechanics at a fairly steady pace, which is always good.
The music, GUI, and graphics also aren't very intrusive, leaving the primary focus on the puzzles themselves.
If you like fun puzzle games with simple mechanics but hard puzzles then you'll like this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984315222', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1518259911}
review:
[h1]A great puzzler.[/h1]

[b]Review[/b]
[h1]Design:[/h1]
The colors are beautifully picked and the different themes are well done. I can see this being a mobile game more than a computer game, but that's no bummer, we need more beautifully designed games like this. [b]10/10[/b]

[h1]Music & Audio:[/h1]
Solid. Very solid. The backgroundmusic and audio is cute and reasonable. It gets a bit boring after a while tho, even if you play this game in one bite. More diversity. [b]8/10[/b]

[h1]Gameplay & Addiction:[/h1]
A great game with different approaches slowly rolling in feature after feature. I like this very much. There is no better tutorial than actually playing the game and introducing new features time after time. Sadly this game is way to short. [b]7/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197975413392', 'num_games_owned': 7384, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1559008732}
review:
Wow, another great game from Maciej Targoni and Wojciech Wasiak!

I am a big fan of another of their games, called Hook. I discovered it about a year or so ago. Since I like to support indie developers and love a good puzzle game, it seemed like a small risk at 99 cents to try that game out due to the positive reviews.

I was, ahem, [i]hooked[/i] immediately. The game features simple, clear graphics combined with interesting (and yet still simple) mechanics, introducing new concepts along the way and then later combining concepts to create more elaborate puzzles.

Klocki follows in this tradition, but with all new mechanics. It begins with needing to switch tiles around to match up patterns and complete what resemble circuits. Honestly, at first I thought, "man, this is a little too simple. If I'm just switching tiles the whole time, this is going to get old quickly." Fortunately, right when you feel like you've mastered the puzzle, a new mechanic of rotating tiles in place is introduced. This is still nothing earth-shattering, but then the two mechanics are combined to create a more interesting puzzle.

This continues where more new mechanics keep getting introduced: rotating large sections of tiles with a "handle," broadening the solution surface from a flat space to a 3D shape (where the solution requires you to connect pieces across the surface), separating black squares to leave white dots which cannot be next to one another, sliding tiles, and a variety of "blob" shapes (for lack of a better term) which have to be assembled in such a way that the resulting shape has all smooth edges.

That's a lot of different things, right? Yep, and when all of these get combined toward the end, the last few puzzles get pretty fiendish, although you should still be able to solve even these in a matter of a few minutes. That's another thing that makes this game work: the puzzles are challenging, feel fair, are satisfying when you solve them, but never turn into such frustrating head-scratchers that you want to rage quit. It's evidence of excellent balance in a puzzle game.

It's entirely possible that you'll solve the whole thing in one sitting like I did, and that this will take less than an hour. Hey, the game's only a dollar, and you pay more per minute to go see some mediocre movie. In the end, your entertainment value here is much higher. 

I'm impressed enough with the two games I've played from these developers that I've purchased the other games they've made and look forward to trying these out as well in the near future.

TLDR: this is a must-buy for anyone who enjoys original puzzle games and likes to support indie developers. At only a buck, you should just stop reading, buy this game now, and spend the next hour playing it instead of reading reviews.  :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198025388508', 'num_games_owned': 628, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1515852009}
review:
just finished it, and it was a nice journey
not too hard, but not too easy either
several different mechanics that mix together make it really dinamic
would enjoy a sequel or expansion someday~

down sides: (developers, have this in mind if you plan an update or sequel)
- not much replayability, as expected, which could be solved with community made puzzles
- no extra challenges like a move counter to try doing it in as few moves as possible
- no main menu to choose levels individually, only scrolling forwards or backwards

TL;DR a slightly challenging and otherwise relaxing puzzle, limited but fair for the price

author: {'steamid': '76561197993502256', 'num_games_owned': 2488, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1515209125}
review:
Um die Ecke gedacht.

klocki ist ein kleines Denk-Spiel, wo man Felder austauscht, dreht, und durch die Gegend schiebt. Dabei ist man immer drauf bedacht, gewisse Regeln einzuhalten, die einem nach und nach beigebracht werden. Dabei ist die Vielfalt und die Verbindungen, wie man die Welt manipulieren kann umfangreich und mit steigendem Schwierigkeitsgrad eingesetzt.

Grafisch und soundtechnisch ist das Spiel eher minimalistisch, aber vollkommen ausreichend. Eine Story gibt es nicht. Hier geht es ganz allein um die RÃ¤tsel, die man lÃ¶sen soll.

Wer also ein recht einfaches, aber schÃ¶n gemachtes Denkspiel haben mÃ¶chte, der kann sich klocki gern mal ansehen. Wer denkt, dass Denken nicht sein Spezialgebiet ist, der sollte darÃ¼ber nachdenken, von diesem Denkspiel die Finger zu lassen ... denke ich.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080718027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1651180955}
review: Awesome little game. Took me 45 minutes to play through. The learning curve is nice, the difficulty is so that you can solve all levels in one go but still feel quite challenged at times. Like Hook, part of the fun is figuring out how the parts work but since there are more different mechanics present here in the later levels the added complexity of having to find out how the different parts work together in this particular level adds a whole lot of fun and complexity. A definite must for puzzle fans looking for something fun, challenging for one evening.

Totally worth the asking price. Nice!

review:
Great little puzzle game. 

PROS:
-Beautiful design with vibrant colors and minimalistic interface
-Difficulty curve goes up smoothly, no hard brick walls at any one level
-Price is a bargain
-Lots of different mechanics


CONS:
-It feels short, you will finish it and wish there were more levels

author: {'steamid': '76561198428518240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1514736792}
review:
A logic-based puzzle game completely devoid of any and all instruction, the first challenge of klocki is to deduce your controls. Following that, the game progressively introduces new mechanics which must be experimented with in order to discover how they work before you can actually solve the puzzles they're included in.

The game is short, with myself (one who typically completes games very slowly) completing the game in under 1.5 hours, but I would not count this against the game given its low price. And of course, your experience with vary depending on how much you enjoy logic puzzles and how quickly you can teach yourself new mechanics as they appear.

Overall, I would definitely recommend klocki to lovers of logic-puzzles. Avoid if dislike figuring out things for yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006944005', 'num_games_owned': 3404, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1558947895}
review:
*Ğ ÑƒÑÑĞºĞ¸Ğ¹ Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ·Ñƒ

(Developer gifted me the game when I contacted him after purchasing the Android port of this game via Humble Bundle to find out whether or not there are any differenses between PC and mobile versions. He suggested that I see for myself and sent me a Steam key for free which was pretty nice of him. The game has no achievements on Android but seemed to be easier to control via touch)

Honestly at first I had thought that I was not going to recommend this game but after completing it (which takes between an hour and two if you're as bad as I am) I decided that it is definitely worth playing. It's a puzzle game where you have to turn, twist, switch places of planes of different types to make the picture composition flow. The game did not have any options menu so I could not change the resolution to make the game run smoothly on my weak ultrabook which is why the game's framerate was a bit low. I could not keep the sound effects but switch off the music because it got a tiny bit repetitive. The menu to chose the level wasn't designed well making me go through all the levels between the one that I wanted to play and the one that I was currently on. NEVERTHELESS the whole experience just got to a point that it made me adjust to its' meditative wave which made it enjoyable. The gameplay itself is quite nice with levels starting very easy and getting a bit harder level by level while introducing new mechanics where the game becomes a bit easy again so there is this nice wave of difficulty which doesn't make you feel stupid and frustrated even if you are as bad as I am with puzzle games but it remains challenging enough throughout the whole game. Also the pictures you create with the planes and the music complement the overall wavy and meditative feel of the game. The achievements are perfect to my taste. It was fun. Might be a bit too easy for veteran puzzle enthusiasts.
___________________________________

author: {'steamid': '76561198006889794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1527479841}
review:
(Disclosure: I recieved this game as a free steam gift from a friend.)

Despite there not being a single word anywhere in the game, I never had confusion on what to do, sign of excellent tutorial levels.
Gradual ramp up in difficulty, culminating in levels that are very daunting, but solvable through gradual chipping away at their pieces.
Took me a bit under an hour to beat, with me playing as fast as I can, but I enjoyed every second. Sounds and movement of each variety of puzzle piece is distinct and reactive to your mouse speed, which makes the game satisfying even just to interact with and listen to.

The game also gave me some almost primal satisfaction in the act of finding order and patterns in a chaotic mess, in a way that's kinda hard to articulate. The same sort of feeling completing a jigsaw puzzle gives you.

Overall this game is Just. Plain. Satisfying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016728868', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1513680330}
review:
Reeeally slow difficulty ramp up and the game doesn't change much. You just move the stones differently, but you are not required to think differently about the solution itself, which is the key in this kind of game.
Should have utilized more [spoiler]of the invisible feeling when you are solving shapes of the same color as background. And the rotation mechanic where you actually move whole plane to different location [/spoiler]
And giving option [spoiler] to rotate cells to change pieces [/spoiler] just breaks the game for me. There's too much freedom with that feature.
But loved the visual art changes with colors, mechanic color differentiation and that smooth feel for the whole game.
+1 for mute option, still no cross to close though :).

Hook was more enjoyable by the solution finding side, this one is visually more attractive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056223771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1511757259}
review:
klocki is a fairly easy puzzle game where you are moving, flipping and turning puzzle pieces to get the solution patterns, which you learn as you go along.  The difficulty does increase a bit as the game progresses.  

I played through this game in one sitting and it was both relaxing and enjoyable.  I was going to stop at puzzle 69, as there is no indicator to tell you how much of the game is left.  But I managed to glean my puzzle level from looking at online solutions, not that I needed help with any of them.  You get an achievement for solving all 72.

review: A relaxing puzzle game that doesn't feel frustrating or unsolvable. There's much larger variety of mechanics compared to Hook, also by the same developer, such as rotating sections and joining shapes. Discovering the functions of each piece was a joy and finishing a puzzle gave a sense of satisfaction. It's a short and sweet game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116193767', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1512086007}
review:
[h1] Klocki - o jogo sensacional de mover pedras [/h1]

Eu comprei porque estava muito barato. 
Comprei porque tinham sobrado uns troquinhos da Summer Sale.
Peguei esse jogo porque sim... nÃ£o esperava nada!

[h1] Pontos Positivos: [/h1]
[list]

[*] O desafio! Confesso que nunca imaginei que o desafio seria tÃ£o interessante

[*] A forma como o jogo reinventa sua prÃ³pria mecÃ¢nica e te desafia no prÃ³prio desafio. VocÃª comeÃ§a movendo pedras para formar as figuras. Depois vocÃª move as pedras e gira blocos. Eventualmente vocÃª move trÃªs tipos distintos de pedras com comportamentos diferentes, alÃ©m de mover blocos inteiros e outras coisas mais

[*] O teste de paciÃªncia e atenÃ§Ã£o que os desafios vÃ£o propondo Ã  medida que vocÃª avanÃ§a nos estÃ¡gios prÃ³ximo ao fim

[*] Pode parecer negativo para muitos, mas existir apenas UMA conquista (a de finalizar todos os desafios) foi pra mim um "gÃ¡s a mais".
[/list]

[h1] Pontos Negativos: [/h1]

[*] A trilha sonora enche "os pacovÃ¡s" depois de um curto tempo (eu mesmo mutei o jogo e fiquei ouvindo minha playlist)

[*] Apesar de bastante desafiador, nÃ£o posso negar que me surpreendi com a rapidez com a qual terminei o jogo (1 hora e 1/2)

[*] Alguma coisa (talvez no design, trilha ou algo mais) fez com que eu, apesar da diversÃ£o, me sentisse cansado com o jogo e nunca de fato fisgado.
[/list]
 Creio que para um jogo casual de puzzle este jogo entrega o que promete e pelo preÃ§o acredito que mereÃ§a a sua atenÃ§Ã£o:
[h1] 8 [/h1]

Faltou alguma coisa para aquele "jogo excelente" - mas Ã© um jogo muito bom. Gosta de puzzles e desafios? Pode experimentar este game sem medo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032632811', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 758, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1511848704}
review:
Klocki is a great of example of silently guiding functionality of mechanics through geometry and the playerâ€™s own intuition and exploration.

Despite being a short game, it all feels well-paced. New types of tiles and spaces come up very often and really make the hour fly by. You never feel like you didnâ€™t get enough time with any ideas either.

Every time a new piece was placed, it feels great to move it around for the first time, discovering its simple function. From here you begin to see how a piece moves with other groups of itself and what patterns emerge from there. Klocki then progressively becomes more and more rewarding as you see your skills with each type of piece combine until youâ€™ve created rules and patterns that you apply on a final gauntlet of bigger puzzles

Meanwhile, an ambient soundtrack keeps your mind clear and the occasion lower tone played after finishing a puzzle provides a nice boost of endorphin.

Klocki is inexpensive and a great brief yet complete game worth picking up for an hour of meditative tinkering. Itâ€™s also got trading cards and an easy 100% if youâ€™re into gridding up your steam profile.
Iâ€™m found to be really enjoying the games from Steamâ€™s [i] Relaxing Puzzle Box Bundle [/i] featuring other games from Maciej Targoni and Wojciech Wasiak. On sale itâ€™s a first-rate deal!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004822148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1511558205}
review:
A nice collection of easy puzzles that appeals to my tidying-up instincts. I wish it got more difficult, but it's fine for what it is.

The sliding-square-blocks parts were kind of annoying; I tend to feel those types of puzzles are more tedious than fun, but this game gives lots of free spaces, so it's only a little tedious, and adding rotations into the mix kept it interesting.

review: Minimalism is such a nice thing. The game starts and you are straight on the puzzle you left it and then when you want to leave you just press the esc key and you are out again. author: {'steamid': '76561198003881107', 'num_games_owned': 822, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1510484757}
review:
Very relaxing puzzle game with some fairly unique, at least to me, mechanisms for piece manipulation. The type of puzzle and how you maneuver pieces was varied enough to present both a minute challenge and variety to gameplay. 

The only con is that the game was rather short; I was able to finish it in under an hour. I would like to see a puzzle creation mode for finishing the game.

Klocki ist ein kurzes Puzzlespiel. Die RÃ¤tsel sind keine groÃŸe Herausforderung. TatsÃ¤chlich sah es auf der Shopseite besser aus, als es eigentlich ist. Zugegeben: Es hat Potential, aber dieses Potential wird nicht richtig ausgeschÃ¶pft! FÃ¼r 1,5 Stunden Spielzeit, ist es etwas zu kurz geraten. Es gibt keine MenÃ¼s, Texte oder Sprachausgaben, was dazu fÃ¼hrt das dieses Spiel fÃ¼r jede Sprache geeignet ist. Das Spielprinzip ist leicht zu lernen und selbst wenn was neues hinzukommt, fuchst man sich schnell hinein. Nervig ist die Musik, welche ich nach ein paar Minuten abgestellt habe. Der Kostenpunkt lag bei unter einem Euro, was gar nicht mal so verkehrt ist. Es gibt 3 Sammelkarten, die man nicht in der Spielzeit bekommt (Man muss das Spiel etwas lÃ¤nger laufen lassen, wenn man die will) und es gibt 1 Errungenschaft, welche beim letzten Level freigeschalten wird. Es fÃ¤llt mir schwer dieses Spiel positiv zu bewerten, da es wie schon gesagt Potential hat. Dennoch sage ich: Nicht Empfehlenswert!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198315341412', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1527206430}
review:
[h1][b]8/10[/b][/h1] 

[h1][b]TLDR:[/b][/h1] 
Very well made, the puzzles get more difficult the farther you go. Great casual/relaxing game. 

[h1][b]Basically...[/b][/h1] 
A puzzle game with different "abilities" as you progress. You click to shift pieces on the puzzle and try to connect the lines  (pink line with pink, yellow with yellow, blue with blue, etc). Pretty simple

[h1][b]Graphics:[/b][/h1] 
Really creative and minimalistic look, which is what everyone is lovin' now. 

[h1][b]Controls:[/b][/h1] 
Click pieces to shift them/rotate them

[h1][b]Overall...[/b][/h1] 
It has great art and is worth buying, especially if it is on sale. 

[b]Pros:[/b] 
- Great art/graphics
- Creative and difficult (kinda) puzzles 
- Easy to 100% 

[b]Cons:[/b]
- None

author: {'steamid': '76561198180024629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1506478945}
review:
If you are looking for a relaxing puzzle game with a nice soundtrack, then this is what you want.
If you are looking for something that is going to frustrate you with how hard it is, then this ISN'T what you want.
Engaging, but not particularly hard, it was a fun game to play when I needed something to chill out too after playing more challenging games.
Overall, its great, but it is what it says on the tin, no surprises here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972387774', 'num_games_owned': 563, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1505953447}
review:
This is a nice simple puzzle game that welcomes the player to its mechanics nicely.

The soundtrack is relaxing and the sound effects are immersive.

The game is enjoyable and there is very little to flaw the game on. My biggest gripe is that there are no more puzzles.


Playing time: Approx. 1 hour (?) (some afk time in there - though your mileage will vary)

author: {'steamid': '76561198248174758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1505545949}
review:
While this puzzle game is short enough to finish in one sitting, it was enjoyable and fun to play. There were some puzzles that confused me and got me fiddling with the puzzle, but once I figured it out, i felt a rush of relief and joy of overcoming it. The color schemes were pretty and easy on the eyes and the patterns that were formed were beautiful looking. 

They throw you straight into the game, no menu or settings other than going back to past puzzles and muting, but I think that is for the best as this is a minimalist game and a minimalist setting it best. However, there are some parts where a lack of words does confuse you for a few seconds.

Overall, this game is a beautiful minimalist puzzle game and relaxing to play with. While there is no replay value, it is a puzzle game that you can play again. A game to relax to and not ruin your day.

there are tons of games(?)  here that are not worthy of the name, and depend on Steam Cards to make a sale. Klocki is just the opposite, it just got cards and achievement (yes, singular, it's only one) when it was already popular.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969749884', 'num_games_owned': 2459, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 1282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1529224687}
review:
Klocki is one of the shortest yet also one of the most brilliant puzzle games I have ever laid eyes upon. It is entirely soothing while actually providing quite a challenge. The game features several different puzzle mechanics which also get woven into another and it is a joy to behold to solve smaller parts of the bigger puzzles and then watching them all come together.

Didn't expect anything and got this solely due to the overwhelming positive reviews and because it was just one buck.

Got completely blown away by the sheer amount of amazingness this little gem holds. If anyone had fun playing LYNE, you'll love this tenfold.
