author: {'steamid': '76561198083736752', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1504440907}
review:
klocki, On MetaCritic, it shows it was developed by Megabyte Bomb. Released on the PC platform on Jul 13, 2016 and is also available on Iphone,Ipad. There are no user reviews yet as of this writing. (http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/klocki). 

On steam page, it shows klocki was developed by Maciej Targoni and Wojciech Wasiak. The same people who brought us Hook. klocki is also available on Linux.

To say klocki is just "a puzzle game" - it is a unjust description on this product. 
For me, I would describe klocki as creative, innotive puzzle game. Because it introduces mechanics/multiple combination of methods to solve a puzzle. This is what makes klocki interesting & fresh. It stand's out from the rest of the other puzzle genre games.

Controls, Audio and Visuals
It only uses Mouse control. No video/sound options. There's feedback sound on every block/click you make. The background music is light and relaxing - something very soothing.

Visually, its bright & colorful. 

Game Mechanics
klocki uses mix n match, rotating, reversi-like, number slide-like elementals to solve it range of puzzles. The difficulty gradually rises. So it does *not* shock the audience of the product. There's a little surprise at the last level puzzle. It shows this  is a labor of love.

My personal thoughts:
I don't really  play a lot of puzzle games because of my horrible past experience with them. The excruciating pain & frustration you put your mind through. The time and effort ..It feels as if my brain would [b]BURST[/b] if I continue further. 

Luckily, klocki does not put you through that sort of horrible gaming experience. There were some very tricky-crazy puzzles but it's still manageable. Overall, I was impressed with this simple, polished product. Good work with klocki, devs. Kudos. Keep up the good work.

I do have 2 points to share, hopefully the developers will take them into consideration for their future products.
[list]
[*]I would love to see a simple level design because there might be younger audience or people who are stuck in a particular level and unable to advance. It's a painful experience for them and at least with this design, they are given the option to skip a level and come back in the future to complete that particular level. This also serves as a replay-ability option and people would have an easier time making videos, showcasing klocki on youtube,etc.

I understand this request comes with revamping the whole level progression and unlocking achievement triggers. If you are unable to make all the changes for klocki, do it for future products. =)

[*]Video option: I would certainly love to play this in a window mode. It doesn't have to be full screen all the time.
[/list]


My Summary:
klocki was surprisingly relaxing and enjoyable - for me. That's not usually the case when I am playing puzzle genre games. lol. Creative mechanics, soothing audio, clean bright visual designs, I couldn't ask for anything more. It also has a fair pricing for this small scale of product. It's really worth it. I am pretty sure kloki has enough challenge for everyone; kids, teens & adults. On the scale of 0 - 10, my personal rating for klocki is a solid 8/10.

#Edit1: Had to to replace a word - else the sentence would be misinterpreted.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991128699', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1527270547}
review:
Fun puzzle game with delightfully complicated levels. It's all about 'wholeness' or 'completion', using lines, shapes and unwritten rules that make it all more complex. Very enjoyable and original.

It would be nice to have some sort of menu, though, where I can see what level I'm on and how many are left and whatnot.

review: Very unique puzzle game. Starts off pretty easy but the levels quickly escalate into more of a challenge, mostly due to new mechanics opening up around every 10 levels or so. Soundtrack is absolutely amazing, and the ambience of it really helps the atmosphere. Only real issue is the game's length. All in all, klocki is a great game for if you have a spare dollar lying around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092313524', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1501483194}
review:
Klocki is a short minimalist puzzle game where you move tiles around until every tile connects into its own shape(s). There are 82 puzzles in this game, and it took me about an hour and 15 minutes to complete it. There is only one achievment for the game and it's for finishing it. The ambient music is calming and not distracting. The puzzles were interesting, but not terribly difficult (there was only one that I got stuck on for any decent amount of time - the rest of them I could move around and sort of figured it out as I went).

I think, overall, it was a decent puzzle game that is worth its price if you are just interested in a casual puzzle experience to keep your brain active. One thing I wish they had was some sort of level counter and/or a menu where it showed all the levels by number, because as it is now you don't know how much content is actually in the game until you finish it and even then if you wanted to know how many levels there actually were (like I did for this review) you would have to page all the way from the first puzzle to the last counting them yourself. Of course, this probably isn't a huge deal with those who just want to play a game and when it ends it ends, but for those wanting to know the quantity of puzzles they are paying for that little added bit would have polished the game up more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198404253604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1510121017}
review: Good little inexpensive game with calming music and visuals. Fun to play on a touch screen, although I often played using the mouse as well. All the reviews say it'll take you an hour, but I did it at a really relaxed pace (often texting or doing other things, as I like to do with casual games...am I the only one? oh well I guess most people on Steam are like *~*Gamers~*~), and it took me an hour and a half. I don't understand the reviews complaining they got through it in 30 minutes while looking up the answers on YouTube...what did you expect? You could probably come back to this game after a while and have fun with it again, you'd just figure everything out faster the second time around.

Un buen juego de puzzles para pasar un rato entretenido.

Colorido y relajante; visualmente agradable, con mÃºsica tranquila. No tiene cronÃ³metro ni puntuaciÃ³n, puro antiestres.

Tienes que usar diferentes mecanismos que se entrelazan para resolver los  rompecabezas. Aunque la dificultad es realmente baja, te dara al menos una hora de tranquilidad.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996941383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1500783755}
review: Very good puzzle game. Not at all short or easy for me. It took me more than two hours to complete it. I feel a little dumb but at least I completed it. I recommend it to everybody who wants a fun, minimalistic but hard game and wants to support such a great indie developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174641061', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1500579099}
review:
Clean, minimalistic, simple. While I did expect the puzzles to be a lot more complicated, the game is indeed well-worth its' price of admission... making it a better gift than Bad Rats, I'll say that much.

The final stage made me smile, too. <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198045130436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1500503260}
review:
It's short alright, however, what makes up for the length is how clever some of the puzzles are.
Worth the 80p if you don't mind it being a short puzzle game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077245678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1527391940}
review:
It's one of the shortest puzzle games I've ever played (1.2 hours, that's a personal best on Steam ^^) and it starts very boring â€“ as it's designed for the casual mobile market. I was about to quit out of lack of challenge, when the black tiles saved the day. Later on, a few other mechanics spiced it more...
Maybe a little bit too many mechanics, though, for a game that's supposedly so minimal. I wasn't fond of the sliding one (I must say I never liked sliding tile puzzles), could have done a few more fun levels and without this one mechanic.

Overall, it's still a very good, and surprisingly enough, little puzzle game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142428668', 'num_games_owned': 2729, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1500256864}
review: Short, beautiful, fun, and leaves you scratching your head several times. I loved the graphics and different mechanisms each level brought. While not the most difficult puzzle game in the world, it's a relaxing difficulty I enjoyed. The colorfulness and relaxing music made this a favorite wind down from the day game. This is the first game from the developer I have played, the second being Hook, and now Iâ€™m a fan. I look forward to future games by this developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088076629', 'num_games_owned': 720, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1498307258}
review:
Pretty original concepts for such a cheap game, can get quite confusing with the amount of different types of puzzles it features. Towards the end with the amount of tiles I did get really confused and temporarily stereoblind because you have to look at individual panels of the puzzles which messes with your head.

It's cheap, and it's not wasted money!

review: This was a surprisingly fun little puzzler for me.  I'd seen this game come up a few times in discovery queues and finally decied to get it.  It starts off about as easy as it comes.  We're talking toddler level puzzles.  Then they get harder until you reach a few head scratch puzzles towards the end.  Nothing is overly complex however and they can be finished in about an hour with an achievement at the end.  The game lacks in features though.  You can move back and forward through what you've done before and turn off the music and that's about it.  No idea how many puzzles there are as there was no menu or listing of them.  No menu at all anywhere.  Escape closed the game for me and Alt-Enter windowed it.  It was pretty barebones.  In fact the only way you know you finished is by recognizing the first puzzles were back.  But overall, it was relaxing and fun and I didn't really want to stop playing until I'd finished them all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163492016', 'num_games_owned': 2622, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1499252915}
review:
I really enjoyed every single bit of this game, I'm not really good at writing reviews, nor do I write a lot so here is a quick pros and cons list.

PROS : 
The price, for just under a Dollar, this is wonderful
The puzzles are mostly easy to understand
Good timing on switching things up to keep the levels being too repetitive
Really nice and relaxing music to help focus
So pretty and lovely to look at
Good challenges here and there, nothing too difficult but hard enough to get the gears turning
It also now has cards and an achievement

CONS :
Only options are for sound (on/off)
No level select menu
Pretty short (finished in about an hour w/o a walkthrough of any sort)
No real replayability here (even though I have gone through the entire game about twice now just for fun because I like it so much)

author: {'steamid': '76561198050443931', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1499110840}
review:
Very relaxing game. Extremelly minimalist. NO time clocks to rush you in. NO achievements to track,.. just you some puzzles and enjoyment. This game is to unplug from the world and relax while exersizing your brain. 

I finished the game in a couple of days and only way I could tell is because the puzzles looped. I wish there was a menu to select at least types of puzzles and to to back and play some of my favorite ones. 

Overal short game, good game, well worth the  dlls I paid for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045216871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1499107490}
review: Good puzzle game. It started off a bit slow for me, but it becomes difficult when you get to the 3d shapes and more complex mechanics are added in. The later puzzles are tough but do-able and are, all together, fun! I feel like these puzzles would be great for adventure games. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197995905130', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1499040429}
review:
klocki is a very fun small puzzle game, that caught my attention being a fan of "Hook" by the same developer. And I mean small, I finished in less than 2 hours. It has nice visuals and intuitive mechanics that are introduced gradually. The short length means the game never outstays its welcome, I never found a level tedious, or having to deal with too much of the same thing. All very varied and well designed puzzles that make you think. In the early levels you can get around by doing random moves but that's not going to fly later on. Good soothing music and sound too! Made for some great late night winding down.

Recommended!

As of writing this review the Linux version doesn't work full screen. Windowed fully playable, only a minor complaint.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275077492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1499031759}
review:
"Overwhelmingly positive".. mh the disappointment when a game does not live up to its positive reviews.. I have just started the game, but I feel I already want to review it for the one's who might be equally convinced by the positive reviews.

I have played similar puzzle games before (LYNE, Hooks, Hexcells, and those I would recommend all). And yes, this game has nice relaxing music, but the colours are a lot stronger than they seemed in the video. And that was not really relaxing for me actually. The games I mentioned are doing a way better job in creating a relaxed atmosphere with music and visuals. 
Now the puzzles are also kind of boring, at least there are too many easy ones. You only need one or two to understand the rules of a new system, but not 5 or whatever. Some more difficult puzzles were interesting, but then the colours were too strong for my taste and I just wanted to get it done to get a change of colours.

Maybe for a person who doesn't play other puzzle games and likes strong colours it might be interesting, but for other players who know this type of game, I would not recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000324986', 'num_games_owned': 1380, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1499030432}
review: The creator of this game must be absolutely brilliant, and for me, the game inspires genuine awe for the ingenuity of humanity. The puzzles gently and naturally introduce a bunch of mechanics and then masterfully interweave them to create a relaxing game experience that bends the rules of geometry and requires some creative thinking. Others have said the game is too short, and I can't comment on that yet, since I have only played a half hour and have yet to beat it, but I'd say if you like puzzle games, this one is definitely worth the asking price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204022688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1498928230}
review:
Out of the bundle that this was sold in during the summer sale, this one was definitely the best. For a quick little puzzle game, this one introduced some mechanics I have yet to see, and the color pallet was spot on. I got stuck a few times but nothing too tough that'll turn you off from the game. If you're looking for something quick to pick up when you're in the airport or something, this is that game! 

9/10!! Wish it was longer!! :~)

author: {'steamid': '76561197998785170', 'num_games_owned': 1759, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1498967529}
review: The puzzles are more satisfying than challenging, although some of them get fairly interesting toward the end. Really it's the presentation of it that makes it what it is. Everything looks and sounds perfect, which makes it very relaxing to play and easy to focus on the puzzles themselves. The level complete chime is one of the best sounds I've heard in a long time, and the game is worth playing just to hear that every time you get something right. This absolutely fits right in in the bundle with stuff like Hook and Zenge, which are also great, minimalist puzzle games in the same vein.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079983754', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1498956806}
review: My only gripe is that I cannot play more of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010652679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1498946955}
review:
A lovely little puzzle game, with simple mechanics that progress gradually throughout via the introduction of new elements.  There are around 80 puzzles which can be solved in around an hour, so there's a decent amount of content for the bargain price.  The puzzles are pleasing without being overly taxing, and all mechanics are self-explanatory; click on something and you'll see what it does.

Presentation is pleasant, with simple and slick design, and soothing music.  One minor niggle is the lack of a level counter to show progress, but there's nothing else to criticize.

review: this is, hands down , the best puzzle game i've ever played. It may look generic, but it is so well constructed, and so well soundtracked, it generates an emotional feel as you play. Some bits are "easy" some bits are more difficult, but it never feels frustrating. Progession is steady, and  it never hold you by the hand or explains anything, so you feel any progress made is off your own back. I would recommend 100%. Its under a quid, just buy it. Honestly  just buy it and see what you think.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077060716', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1596720125}
review: I can say in confidence that this game is indeed very interesting, it's worth more than it's price and is developing the human brain to think outside of the box, you ask how? by completing several of amazing puzzles, they get harder the more you progress through the game, but not only that! the game doesn't want you to get bored so it adds more into the puzzle every time you complete a level, it adds different mechanics as well as different ways of completing the puzzle, it's very good and I recommend it to people who like puzzles, 10/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025245786', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1498644420}
review: Intuitive and the controls are pretty good, although dragging the sliding blocks with my mouse sometimes annoyed me, because you click everything else. The music isn't intrusive. Way too short, though. The puzzles don't take much trial and error to solve if your visual-spatial skills are good (e.g. you've played a lot of Tetris) and the most complex puzzles were more tedious than challenging. Figuring out the rules for each new element is the most challenging part (the dots took me several puzzles to understand that they had a restriction and how that worked). I've played longer iphone puzzle games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198388566866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1498427173}
review: It's worth the price, but not really worth playing. It's an interesting set of puzzle dynamics, but it's not a particularly long game... Right as it seemed I was getting into it, it cycled back to the first level. It's a unfortunate because this is a game where you could easily program it to auto-generate new puzzles, and yet there's a limited amount of them to solve. Without more puzzles or the ability to generate new ones randomly, the game has no replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039699496', 'num_games_owned': 1488, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1498512061}
review: Minimalistic it truly is. I'd say, in between logical and clickers. Feels more like a chore. Lot of clicking, little thinking. It's saddening that this type of "minimalistic logical" game receives one of the highest user score on steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042701126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 847, 'last_played': 1497866348}
review:
A very good and relaxing puzzle game settled by calm music to build up the mood that transported into a meditative state while playing this game, more so that you may risk fall asleep if you immerse yourself too much in it, not a bad thing sometimes if ask me. 

 I had a lot of fun playing and at some point, it did get challenging because some levels are just dam genius and really help keeping you interested in what`s next.

It's a really cheap game for what you can remove from it, and if you're looking for a calm puzzle game, this may be a good option to keep you entertained.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981706607', 'num_games_owned': 4157, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1498352729}
review: This is a low stress casual puzzle game, where you flip, rotate, and switch out tiles to make closed loops.  It sounds simple, but there are increasingly complex permutations (multiple cubes, shifting of tile directions and positions, black tiles that can't be next to other black tiles, or a combination of all of the above in one puzzle).  There are no time limits or move limits, it's just you exploring the minimalistic puzzles until everything works out.  It's a serene, calming experience, even as the puzzles become real brain teasers. There aren't a huge number of levels - it took me 90 minutes to complete the game, and I was doing other things at the time. But for a $1.00 game, it's a very nice casual experience.

review:
This game is beyond a minimalist puzzle game. It is also a very well made game of design. The puzzle as they gradually increase in mechanics do so in a very intential and well thought out way. 

I highly recommend it as it is more fun the deeper it goes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993146844', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1498251742}
review: Short but sweet. Takes a while to get going... There are too many trivial puzzles early on and I almost thought it would stay that way, but after that, new game mechanics are thrown in and combined together in interesting ways. It actually reminds me a lot of Monument Valley, in a good way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136732308', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1710492093}
review:
This game was fun and challenging. I enjoyed almost of the mechanics as well, though I likely have a distate for it due to my experiences with that type of puzzle mechanic as a child. However, despite my personal preferences, the game molds together its mechanics rather well, which made for some very interesting levels. I'm also inclined to believe that each puzzle (at least the later ones) are able to be solved in multiple ways. All in all, a very enjoyable use of my time.

TL;DR - klocki was a fun and difficult puzzler with many well made mechanics. It has a decent amount of replayability and is a very nicely polished game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998886660', 'num_games_owned': 2532, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1497137342}
review:
PRO : 
Nice casual puzzler if your into puzzles.
Puzzle concept changes throughout levels so not always the same mundane puzzles.
Puzzles are mostly easy to understand

CON :
Very short game - completed in a little over an hour
No Instructions whatsoever.
Only option is sound (on/off)

CONCLUSION :
A Good casual puzzler but would not spend any more than $1.00 due to short length and no replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198210010805', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1558916764}
review:
If klocki were priced much higher than it is, I'd have to give this a thumbs down. But the fact of the matter is, the game is very good for its price.

klocki is a simple game: Make all the tiles activate by swapping, rotating, sliding, etc. Some tiles are 'wires' that need to be connected with no loose ends. Some tiles are black boxes that will turn into white circles when they're isolated from other tiles of their kind. Some tiles are circular and rotate on their axis; later levels will have you rotate entire chunks of the level to connect the lines.

It's a short game, so don't expect to spent a whole day playing klocki. And it's not massively challenging, either. All the levels can be solved with a little critical thinking and a solid thought process. But for a dollar it's a pleasant little experience and more than worth the money if you like simple puzzles and have nothing else to use that spare buck on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198249516004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1496811074}
review:
Usually with puzzle games, I find myself having a fun time, a soothing and/or challenging experience, for the first ten or twenty minutes before some actually difficult mechanics are introduced. Normally I'll try to brute force my way past this point or simply give up out of frustration. This game, klocki, resulted in the same experience, and while that mechanic introduced is one I have particular trouble with (slide puzzles), I stuck around because of what came before it. The first twenty-ish minutes of this game were a delight, very relaxing while remaining engaging, likewise surprising and impressing me with new mechanics and elements that were rewarding when overcome. So, looking for more of that, I kept trying and trying to get past the bits that stopped me, and after a good ten or twelve minutes, I was able to do so, learning from the experience, and the rest of the game flew by, not quite as hard as the initial roadblock but not quite as rewarding as the first stretch either. 

And that's what this game was, really. There's not a ton to write about. The graphics are fine for this sort of thing. The music is pretty good, reminding me a lot of A Winged Victory for the Sullen. Moving around various knobs and levers looks, sounds, and feels great. It's short enough that it doesn't feel daunting while also giving you a good chunk of game to get through (apparently I spent nearly two hours with this game, though it felt like quite a bit less). So what you're left with, after all that, is a game that is mentally and emotionally rewarding, which is what puzzle games should be. I'm no expert in the field, but I've played my fair share of puzzle games, and I can't remember one that delighted me quite like this one. Come to think of it, I cant think of one in a long while that I was able to beat before giving up out of frustration, which might be a big part of it. I was a bit let down by the final puzzle, though the ones that came before it sure were a challenge, so I suppose I should think of it more as a soothing epilogue than the final climax. 

In any case, this is a hell of a cheap game and it packs more of a punch than you'd think for that price. Buy it and put it on when you need to come down from a long day of work or just need a break from something. It's certainly worth that much.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982540582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1496697466}
review:
As just about everyone else has said, this is a quite enjoyable little puzzle game - quite short, and not too difficult, but you're introduced to new mechanics pretty frequently, and the game remains fresh throughout.  There's a few very nice moments where the game purposefully messes with your sense of perspective, which was rather pleasing.

The Linux version worked great for me, so thanks for the port!  (Apparently the dev is currently addressing an issue where the Linux version won't run in fullscreen, but it works fine windowed.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198085744382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1496391504}
review:
A good, relaxing puzzle game accompanied by binaural-like music. You really are transported into a meditative state while playing this game (and you might even fall asleep because the music is just so damn serene). I had a lot of fun, and it did get challenging. Some levels are genius.

It's really cheap, and if you're looking for a calm game, this is just perfect.

I might take another listen to that music and...zzzzzzz.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113388537', 'num_games_owned': 4356, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1496405210}
review:
My complete impression that this game is great.
Unforgently there are things i donÂ´t like:
Starting off with the good ones.
The used mechanics are great and the mix makes them even better. My problem here is that the first few levels after the introduction are all simple and well hard to say but boring. This is a flow killer for me. You had a hard level and need to thought about it and in the next four riddles a new mechanic is used with to be honest really easy riddles. 
Only the last 14 riddles are really hard and the best from the game. Not counting the last one.

To finish here:
Klocki is great. It is a realaxing riddle game with a bad fsolving flow in my oppinion. I recommend because the price is nice and worth the experience. But this may not be the best riddle game out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080724645', 'num_games_owned': 3618, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1495274404}
review:
- If you haven't found this review helpful or if you have found a mistake please leave a comment below -
- Note1 : I bought this game as a steam bundle -
- If you want more reviews check my links at the end of this review -

[u][b]Family Rating[/b][/u] 
Everyone
[u][b]Rating[/b][/u] 
Between Good & Must Play
[u][b]Worth[/b][/u] 
Full price

[h1]- Key features below ---- Review after -----------------------------------------------[/h1]

[u][b]Play time needed (perfect)[/b][/u]
Around 1 hour
[u][b]Levels[/b][/u]
82
[u][b]Gaming level[/b][/u]
Between Casual (+) & Gamer (-) 
[u][b]Game style[/b][/u]
Puzzle
 [u][b]Graphics[/b][/u]
Fine
[u][b]Music[/b][/u]
A relaxing ambiant music
[u][b]Controls[/b][/u]
Mouse only. 
[u][b]Tutorial[/b][/u]
No, it's a FIY : Find It Yourself.
[u][b]Glitches / bugs[/b][/u]
No.
[u][b]Size[/b][/u]
About 136 Mo


[h1]- Review below ----------------------------------------------------------------------[/h1]
[u][b]GRAPHICS[/b][/u]
Graphics are fine even if they are a little blinding with some flashy colours.
[u][b]SOUNDS[/b][/u]
With an ambiant music the game feels relaxing, only the sounds doesn't fit in that category.
[u][b]GAMEPLAY[/b][/u]
The first levels are really easy : you need to switch the pieces until you made one or several closed tracks. After that the difficulty is increased. You have a 3d-view and unlock also some tiles that can only be rotated. Then the harder ones will have both rotating and moving tiles at a time.

The game will also features some black & white tiles, the aim is to have all of them white by separating them. That type of tile can't touch another in any adjacent side, if you want to solve the this puzzle. As previously said, the game will also these 3 mechanisms : sliding, rotating, separating.

Finaly in the later levels you'll have some bizarre shapes that you need, like the lines, to create a closed shape.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035285721', 'num_games_owned': 5118, 'num_reviews': 1098, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1497120845}
review:
[h1]"Puzzles like in a clockwork"[/h1]
Very nice puzzle game again. After "Hook" and "Zenge" this is another brilliant puzzle game where you play about 50-60 levels and unlock just 1 achievment. The puzzles variate from turning cube sides, flip different fields or shuffle logic. You have a given goal and try to assemble the puzzle together to reach that goal. Helpful are broken lines which you must stick together or same colored patterns which lead you to heart pieces. Nice game for 1 hour or more

author: {'steamid': '76561198009654132', 'num_games_owned': 2910, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1495973239}
review:
Klocki is an innovative and relaxing puzzle not to be missed.

Pros:
+ Puzzles: theyre great well designed and bring new mechanics as you progress
+ Innovative: Some mechanics are really brilliant
+ Relaxing: both gfx and sfx adds to the relaxed gameplay experience
+ Cheap, has cards

Neutral:
~ Short. But for that price its fair.

10/10 For that price, dont miss that one if you carve for a good puzzle game.

[h1]RejouabilitÃ©, achievements[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197986353054', 'num_games_owned': 5468, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1495733460}
review: It's simple, it's good quality, the puzzles are all unique without too much repetition. A few of them weren't "my kind" but so is life. I'm on the fence recommending it, because it's just so short and so very, very minimalist. That said, there's absolutely nothing wrong with it (really, it's extremely well made), and the puzzles are ok, if never particularly strenuous. Also the price point (~1$) is appropriately low. So if you like puzzles, go for it!

review: A very nice minimalistic puzzle-game with multiple interesting mechanics. Every level feels suitably different from the other ones and the difficulty curve is well balanced. It's very short (about 30 to 40 minutes) but for such a low price it's worth trying this enjoyable brain-teaser.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071533548', 'num_games_owned': 2672, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1495502294}
review: klocki is actually a very nice puzzle/casual game, with minimalistic visual and is very relaxing to play it. Has a lot of different puzzle mechanics and makes you really think in some levels, but mostly is pretty straight forward, you can probably finish it in about 1 hour, that's the only downside, maybe a little too short, but if you like puzzles, I strongly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969752619', 'num_games_owned': 5407, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1495381727}
review:
Fun little casual puzzler. Only takes about an hour to finish if you are used to doing the kind of puzzles usually found in Hidden Object games, like sliding blocks, switch blocks to create a pipeline etc.
Very nice graphics and ambient sound.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966164725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1498660485}
review:
Really satisfying puzzle game. There's nothing better than changing everything to the "you've got it right!" glow. It's a very simple concept, essentially, connect the dots/lines. As the puzzles advance new elements are thrown in: shapes, rotating circles, rotating planes, and 15-puzzle-esque boards,

I'm a big puzzle game fan but I do see how someone unfamiliar with the concepts could struggle. Still, I'd absolutely recommend this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198113106666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1507927110}
review:
This game...

I love it! It's wonderful! Before I got this game when it was on sale, thinking it was just another game- Oh boy I was wrong! It's puzzles are great, it's music is wonderful, and it's just good! The game is simplistic. However, it is challenging in the later stages. This also has no real tutorial, just a couple of easy levels. Is that bad? No! It's wonderful! I haven't beaten this game, but it's already good! I want you to buy it, right now. It's cheaper than it is. But if you don't like puzzles, and hard thinking, then this game is not your thing.  If you do, then buy it!

Overall, this game is cheap, fun, and challenging, if you enjoy puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156702647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1495232605}
review:
I've played it once, some time ago, completed it, and now I've completed it again because of recently added achievement to unlock.

Klocki is a short puzzle game, very relaxing, with nice ambient music, pleasant sounds and minimalistic graphics. I love games that tickle Your brain, and this is one of those games. The game consists of 30 or so puzzles while constantly adding new mechanics to keep You interested. I don't have any issues with this game, it's working flawlessly, You won't experience any bugs at all. The only thing I could hardly even try to moan about would be the time needed to complete it. I've managed to beat it twice in 2 and a half hours. But it's fair considering its low price. Thumbs up.

On a side note, check out other two games by this creator. Oo and Hook are also very fun and relaxing, good quality games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032989995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1494427216}
review:
This is a minimalisc puzzler that consist in combining pieces. The mechanics are simple and the difficulty gradually increases, but it's never something very complex.

It provides a relaxing experience since it consists on a deep and soft soundtrack, and beautiful graphics. It's great when you need to take some time off and think about nothing, because it becomes hard enough to keep your attention, but it will never get to a stressing difficulty.

Its only downside is that it is small. You can finish it in a matter of 1 hour. But, since it's very inexpensive, it's definitely worth it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198208285865', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1494727425}
review:
Klocki es un excelente juego, muy justo para su precio 

Disfrute mucho los colores son simplemente perfectos y muy relajantes al igual que la musica 
La dificultad aumenta constantemente introduciendo nuemvas mecanicas y mezclandolas 

Creo que lo unico malo es el sonido despues de completar un nivel 
Y que es muy corto 

Por el poco bajo precio es muy buen juego bastante recomendable

review:
Very fun game with great puzzles. It is well worth its price and I strongly recommend it. If you want to enjoy it as much as possible DO NOT watch a walkthrough. I must say that I strongly recommend you buy 3 game together (klocki, hook, zenge)
because all three of them are similar with great puzzles and challenges. I can reassure you that you will have great fun playing all three of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980503219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1494886385}
review:
This does exactly what it says on the tin - it's a visual spatial puzzle game with a set series of levels.  It has pleasant uncomplicated visuals and a complete focus on the puzzle.  Some levels are simple, especially the ones teaching you new ways to solve things, and others become quite challenging, without ever quite crossing the frustrating "argh this is too much" line.

It builds complexity gradually, making sure you never end up staring at a screen wondering what to click on or why, but still leaving you with challenging questions on *how* to use what you can click.

The only criticism I can make is that a friend who is severely colour-blind got stuck on a couple of levels and had to fiddle with contrast a couple of times to enable him to make out some of the "done or not done" lines.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999274592', 'num_games_owned': 1119, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1494866079}
review:
Unlike their other games, there's no achievement for finishing this. As I got into the rhythm of solving the puzzles I was so in the zone that I didn't notice the levels had rotated back to the beginning after the last puzzle and solved the first 3 puzzles again before I realised my mistake.

For a dollar, this is a light cheap little toy game that you'll plough through in an hour. It could be a great lateral thinking puzzle for kids who would get a lot more time out of this game.

Recommended at a dollar or less.

review:
Ein simples kleines Puzzlespiel, das entspannt. Die Puzzle sind nicht schwer aber reichen aus, einen nach einem anstrengenden Tag mal wieder abschalten zu lassen, dabei aber trotzdem noch seinen Kopf einschalten muss.
Das Spiel dauert ca. 1 std. und nutz diese Zeit mit immer neue RÃ¤tselideen, die so richtig erst nach den ersten Leveln an Fahrt aufnehmen. Trotzdem wÃ¤ren ein paar richtige Brocken am Ende echt  gut gewesen. Das Spiel hat gute Mechaniken, diese kÃ¶nnte man aber noch mehr nutzen und verknÃ¼pfen.  FÃ¼r 1 Euro ist es aber definiitv ein tolles Spiel, bei dem nur noch ein paar zusÃ¤tzliche level fehlen, die auch ruhig etwas komplizierter sein kÃ¶nnen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114662645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1494282049}
review:
A great, cheap puzzle game. Albeit a little short.

I paid 67p for this game and it took me around 70 mins to complete (under 1p per minute of gameplay). Puzzles are easy at first, but as you progress, new mechanics are introduced that make the game a little more difficult.

The game isn't over difficult to the point where you feel you have to take a break (Ã  la The Witness) but there certainly is a bit of thinking required towards the end of the game, and despite the length, I'd be sure to purchase a sequel if one is made.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076882334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1534820397}
review:
Do you like to solve puzzles? Then just spend a buck and download Klocki.
It's something like the puzzles on MillerWorldInc. It gives you a puzzle, you solve it, and then the next one comes up. You aren't rushed so you don't feel pressured to hurry and can take your time working out the solutions. 
The visuals are clean and the background music is relaxing if you want it on. 
It's easy to save your place because you just hit Esc...done, and the program will remember where you left off when you return.
It's a great little puzzle game to have on your desktop to 'fiddle with' when you have a moment or two to kill.
It also has replay value. It's something that you can constantly come back to from time to time.
Repeat: "Do you like to solve puzzles? Then just spend a buck and download Klocki." Now(;

author: {'steamid': '76561198128239804', 'num_games_owned': 552, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1506982969}
review:
Klocki es un juego de puzzles, para pasar un rato tranquilo y entretenido. Es original, pero su potencial no parece haberse aprovechado por completo. Sus alrededor de 80 niveles podrÃ¡s completarlos en una hora, aproximadamente, y se te harÃ¡ demasiado corto. La mÃºsica de fondo ayuda, acompaÃ±a a la perfecciÃ³n al tempo del juego, pero esto no es suficiente para decir que es un buen juego.
QuizÃ¡s destaca negativamente la sensaciÃ³n inevitable de estar frente a un tÃ­tulo inacabado. Sin menÃº de inicio, sin un final (por sobrio que sea), tan solo volveremos al primer nivel en un bucle infinito. Su ausencia de marcador, ni de indicador de nivel... en fin, sÃ³lo los niveles, y poco mÃ¡s. AdemÃ¡s, la dificultad es muy baja para este estilo de juegos, por lo que nunca representarÃ¡ un reto, y eso lo hace empobrecer demasiado.
La idea es buena, pero el resto se queda atrÃ¡s. Me es difÃ­cil recomendarlo.

NOTA: 5.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198088704417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1584685505}
review: Cute game. Took an hour to do all of the puzzles. It was entertaining to pass the time. A few made me think a bit, but nothing I would call difficult or challenging (for a child many would be). Definitely worth the cheap cost (come on, it's literally one dollar). The colors were very bright, though, so a dark/night skin or a choice of themes would be nice. Achievements would be cool as well, and a menu with level selector would also be handy so you don't have to scroll back/forth one by one. Overall, don't expect a long game with difficult, challenging puzzles. It's extremely casual, but worth the price.

review: It's a great little puzzle game that does an awesome job of making you interpret both 2D and 3D space when solving puzzles. It is however pretty short (I was able to complete all puzzles in exactly an hour) but it is only $0.99. I would say give it a try even if you don't like puzzle games. You might be surprised.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087173152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1489287957}
review:
How much would you pay for a coffee? And how long would it take to drink said coffee?

I bought [i]klocki[/i] this morning, and sporadically throughout the day, I was compelled to come back and play again. And again. And again. And now it's all over. Short and sweet. Worth it? That depends more on you, but I heartily recommend it. That's the tl;drâ€”like puzzles? Buy this game.

Having also played Maciej's [url=store.steampowered.com/app/367580/]Hook[/url] I had high expectations, and was not disappointed. Yes, there is really no replayability, but at just over a dollar Canadian, I felt I got my money's worth. With that said, Maciej, if you read this, do feel free to create more puzzles like this. Or perhaps, like [url=store.steampowered.com/app/265890/]Hexcells[/url], another puzzle game I loved, try to create a version the offers more replayability, [i]Ã¡ la[/i] [url=store.steampowered.com/app/304410/]Hexcells Infinite[/url]. I would certainly buy it.

Overall, this is a short but pleasant puzzle game, with a minimalist design that speaks to me, and a great set of game mechanics. The tiniest quibble I have is the introduction of the black squaresâ€”a mechanic that took me a little longer to figure out than the rest. Still, I cannot fault the game design for that. This is well thought out and worth your time, as brief of an experience as that might be.

Gameplay: 9/10
Audio: null (I muted it. Sorry!)
Graphics: 9/10
Replayability: 3/10

Overall: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198002228389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1564904891}
review:
What a great little game!

I initially played this through Kongregate, and was quite pleased to see the game for sale through Steam. 

Simple, minimalistic, no instructions.

Make connections, light up the lines and shapes, spin and swap blocks about, and that's pretty much the premise of Klocki. 

The gameplay is easy and smooth, the ambient sound track is great and there's no text. 

There's just over 80 puzzles (at this time) and some can be a little challenging, and all of them, I enjoyed. 

I took my time on this, and spent about 90 minutes getting through them, so, although not a lengthy game, it can get your grey matter thinking about things.

There's no massive re-play value, and for less than a quid, what do you expect?

Only a few of the tiniest niggles. Level selection and mayby acheivements. That's it. 

If you enjoy a minimal game, that sometimes gives a challenge, then for the princely sum of 79 English pennies, this one's a winner and should be in your library right now.

review:
You want to play a game. Nothing in your library sounds good but you don't feel like spending money. You want a challenge but you don't want to get frustrated. You want something interesting but you don't want to spend time learning how to play. You think you want a game that doesn't exist.

But actually it does. You want klocki.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068773148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2, 'last_played': 1562007345}
review:
PROS:
beautiful and minimalist visuals
nice ambient soundtrack
puzzles are great
The mechanic that isn't great (the sliding block part) doesn't take up a huge chunk of the game
nice minimalist aesthetic overall

NEUTRAL:
This game doesn't hold your hand, mainly because it doesn't need to.

CONS:
The sliding-block puzzles. 'Nuff said
Rather short (it took me less than 1 hour to finish) with no replay value

CONCLUSION:
While it's short and has no replay value, the (mostly) great puzzles, beautiful visuals, nice and unintrusive background music, and overall great minimalist aesthetic made that short amount of time very enjoyable, and you should buy it if you like puzzle games and liked the online prototype/demo.

P.S:
I know it says I only played it for 0.1 hours, but I actually played it for 55 minutes. It's just the Steam playtime counter reset the time to 5 minutes for some strange reason. Don't ask me how or why, because I don't know how that happened, but don't worry, I played the game for much longer than 0.1 hours.

Al tener formas muy variopintas y mecanismos distintos, en un principio piensas "es imposible sacar esto adelante", pero el propio rompecabezas va cayendo por su propio peso. author: {'steamid': '76561198130516505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 324, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1496200716}
review:
klocki is a minimalistic puzzle game developed by Maciej Targoni, the same person who developed HOOK, another minimalistic puzzle game. 

Pros:
-It is almost perfect minimalistic puzzle game. There is bright colours but not overwhelming, the music and sound effects are not intrusive and are relaxing, the puzzles are challenging but not frustrating. This leaves me enjoying the game, rather than "grinding" to get to the next puzzle
-The game itself is really cheap for the amount of content. For R12 (~$1) you get a good amount of time out of it. (I finished the game within an hour)
-It is easy to pick-up and play, not difficult to figure out what you have to do

Cons:
-I honestly don't have anything to put here.

This impressed me just as much as HOOK did. If you love puzzle game with a minimal feel to them, definitely give this a go.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198037402613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1494638055}
review:
Its a buck (or under) for a small handful of puzzles.  Depending on how much you like puzzles you could blitz through this even quicker than I did since I tend to get stuck a bit at sliding puzzles because I really REALLY hate them and I closed the game a couple times to see what a few friends were saying.

37 minutes.  For a couple dozen puzzles.

...  Eh, if you have a buck to spare there's worse games you could spend it on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095188047', 'num_games_owned': 640, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1522991518}
review:
It only took me 5 minutes to know this is a hit.

Minimalist UI and design.
Response is very snappy.
Visuals are very clear and crisp.
Sound is very satisfying.
Overall aesthetic feels very good.
Feedback from solving a puzzle feels quite satisfying.
Its a cheap game.

Even if its not on sale its only a dollar. Other reviews say its short, but the quality speaks for itself. Developer has a knack for pleasant puzzle games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994122852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1495241712}
review:
This is a fantastic puzzle game! The levels get progressively harder and really starts to make you think more and more! I really enjoyed playing this, just wish there were more levels to it.

The only con I saw with this game is the lack of a menu where you could at least close out the game when you were finished playing it in fullscreen mode. Pressing ESC closes it out, but it doesn't say anywhere that it does. Other than this, it is a very awesome game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198074738035', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1487096165}
review:
A short (1â€“1,5h), minimalist and aesthetic puzzle game.
After 10 very easy tutorial levels it's neither hard nor easy â€” and that's the point!

It literally sooths your mind. 
Tidying up tiles on the board feels like putting thoughts inside your head into neat little drawers, exactly where they belong.

The great thing either is that it speaks for itself. You need to figure out the rules entirely on your own. There is no single word used in the game, just pleasantly colourfull tiles, elegant shapes, chaos, order and you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034824986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1486227754}
review: Like the box says, minimal puzzle game. Very laid back, mobile-like, game which you can play for a few minutes when you've got time to kill or some zen vibes to be had.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069571977', 'num_games_owned': 651, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1507967958}
review:
A relaxing little puzzle game, though short and with no replay value.

The graphics and audio are simple and clear, which is something I like a lot in this genre.

The goals and controls are easy to understand.

One gripe I have is that a lot of early levels present no challenge and are intended as tutorials. Only late in the game the puzzles get interesting force you too focus.

I've beaten it in 1,5h - which is really short (c'mon LYNE is a similar game and I've put 200+h in it). A cheap person could even refund the game after finishing it due to that. Bear in mind it costs only 0,99â‚¬ - you could buy a beer for that much and it would take you less time to drink it.

'klocki - a better value proposition than beer'

author: {'steamid': '76561198244563482', 'num_games_owned': 870, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1485947516}
review:
Klocki is a cute little puzzle game. Its interface is minimalistic. There isn't even a menu! You open the game, it opens at the next unsolved puzzle. You can turn on/off sound and there is a 'back' button to go back a puzzle. That's it. There are no other UI elements, menus or buttons.

The puzzles are composed of puzzle pieces (like in jigsaw puzzles) that you can manipulate (move or rotate etc.) The goal of the puzzle is to arrange these pieces in a way to make the pattern on them 'closed'. I am not really sure how else to describe it. 

Solving them is fun and relaxing at the same time. The game is quite short and can be finished in about 2 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007756933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1494583884}
review:
[h1]Good, but way too short.[/h1]
Described as minimal puzzle game, "klocki" (literally "bricks" in Polish) is exactly that.
Game is so minimalist, that it doesn't even have menu, not even level selection menu - after you finish last level, game cycles back to first one and you can switch between completed levels by pressing next/previous level.
There is no text in game, rules are never explained, instead, progressively more complex levels are built in such a way that player will figure rules out on his own. First level has only two tiles that can be swapped, and from there, game carefully builds very complex puzzles, with myriad of possible combinations, but always solvable purely by logical analysis. Trial and error is never necessary. I very much enjoyed watching how game starts with very simple rules and then, builds something complex.

Graphic style is minimalist indeed. Simple  shapes, simple shades, and simple gradients give it clean and clear look. Music doesn't get in the way, instead works to build mood of serenity. I liked "artistic" side.

My only complaint, is that game is too short, it took me 40 minutes to complete all levels - unless you plan to replay some of them, don't expect to get more than 1 hour out of Klocki, whether it's enough to justify the price, is up to you.

review:
Just wanted to add my thumbs up to this game.  I love simple puzzle games and this is one of the best that I have played.

I especially like figuring out how each puzzle is played.  That is just as enjoyable as solving the puzzle itself.
The end flourish  when you complete each puzzle is very rewarding for some reason. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198025851638', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1483972784}
review:
It would seem that I finished this game in little over an hour, so if you're looking for something challenging to while away the hours then it's probably not for you. 

If, however, you're interested in visually elegant, experimental but fundamentally casual puzzle games, then it's a real steal.

The gameplay involves sliding, rotating and otherwise manipulating tiles into pleasant patterns. Different tiles can be manipulated in different ways, with more complicated levels requiring tiles of different types to be interlinked across orthogonal planes. The gameplay of some later levels can feel a little noisy, but I rather enjoyed the process of navigating a convoluted process in search of a visually simple solution.

Klocki's fundamental appeal is aesthetic; notable touches such as the lack of in game instruction, written interfaces or move counters help to create an isolated but pleasant world in which experimentation is rewarded and mistakes are without consequence.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276020441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1483803021}
review: Aesthetically pleasant and visually interesting, but ultimately uninspired -- less a puzzle game than the spacial reasoning portion of an IQ test given a graphics upgrade. The difficulty curve of klocki remains far too long at "insultingly easy" and barely passes into "mildly puzzling" at its peak. What challenge it does pose derives less from clever mechanics and intellectually stimulating puzzles and more from sometimes unclear rules and odd ambiguities caused by the game's own, admittedly nice, aesthetic getting in the way. Klocki's worst sin is that it is dull in a pretty, inoffensive way, but surely one can do better than dull but inoffensive? Take a shower. Eat some oatmeal. Look out the window for a while -- or perhaps regard a painting or particularly fascinating patch of  wall. The world is your oyster.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037072688', 'num_games_owned': 527, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1483364466}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027503451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1483563282}
review:
I loved Hook and I am enjoying Klocki very much!

It's (just) level after level of fun little puzzle teasers. And then interesting combinations of rules & mechanics to discover. Pretty and lightly engaging, I love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994768862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1559167457}
review: Similar type of game as hook. Not super difficult but entertaining way of presenting the same concept getting increasingly more difficult. Fun puzzle game that I would totally recommend for the price it's sold at.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089526831', 'num_games_owned': 1062, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1590117149}
review: This game is really fun, and would be great to play on long car rides. Unfortunately it only has enough puzzles to last around an hour to finish all of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043926275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1549828401}
review:
Loved Hook, love this one. Relaxing, really satisfying to learn the mechanics by yourself, really satisfying to start by looking at a convoluted mess and see how it turns to something beautiful and clean.

Absolutely love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098920807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1509118170}
review:
klocki is a cool, tiny puzzle game where you connect lines or areas of colour by moving blocks around. There's about an hour's worth of puzzles with a surprising amount of different parts. It doesn't get too difficult so ragequits are unlikely--YMMV!

It's not very interesting to replay, a speedrun timer or moves counter would help to add some longevity. Well worth the â‚¬1 for a single run though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960643409', 'num_games_owned': 1358, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1483249417}
review:
I ended up getting this on the holiday sale for less than a dollar. What a great deal for that price, I enjoyed the puzzles and difficulty ramping up.  

Some opportunities that this game should improve upon?
 - When you beat the game you end up back at the start, i'd enjoy a stats screen
 - Puzzle select screen would be pretty amazing
 - Maybe an achievement would be cool

Overall, i'd buy it if I were you. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198068096048', 'num_games_owned': 827, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1483197650}
review:
Just old puzzle mechanics from other games rehashed. Very short. At least they added a mute button this time.

It's just barely worth the low price though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990604326', 'num_games_owned': 503, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1483195443}
review:
If you've played Hook (same creator), you know pretty much what to expect: some relaxing puzzles, nothing too difficult. I completed all puzzles in just under an hour at a relatively casual pace.

I enjoyed Hook [i]slightly[/i] more because the mechanics were less familiar to me (plus there's no strange perspectives that mess with your depth perception), but both are good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074774057', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1487230373}
review: Really good simple puzzle game for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067996911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1495193924}
review:
The only negatives I really have for this game are that it's too bloody short, and when you complete the last puzzle you get unceremoniously dumped back onto the first puzzle. My exact reaction: "Wait. Is that it? Did I win? Yeah, I guess I did."

Very minimalistic design, which is great if you're into that sort of thing, some cool mechanics, and really nice background music. I would gladly play three more hours' worth of these puzzles if they existed.

So, do you like puzzles? Is a dollar for an hour of fun in a neat little game a good value proposition for you? Did you get more Christmas money than you know what to do with? If you answered yes to one or more of these questions, you should buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969447988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1483046141}
review: Pleasant little game and very good value for just a dollar. The UI is the most minimalistic I've ever seen in my life. There's only 1 option, which is to mute the game and you do it through the circle in the top left. There isn't even an on screen way to close the game. I had to check the forums and do a Google search just to figure out how. Hit escape a couple times to close. Seems like a little X or something in the corner would have been a good idea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083099925', 'num_games_owned': 638, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1482877099}
review:
Klocki is probably one of the best puzzle games I think I have ever played. The perfect balance between self-discovery and challenge, and it has a minimalist UI that you don't even notice is there.

You reach a puzzle that you haven't seen before, and once you solve it, you feel like you have accomplished something with no direction, just good game design. The game progresses very smoothly, and at no point have I found myself looking for solutions to solve the puzzles. At the price? 10/10 I literally can't fault this game.

review: Another great idea for a game even if not quite finished. For under a dollar it's not a total waste if you know that play time is only about one hour. Looks are great, I just wish for more levels (way more!) and some sort of statistics for the number of moves, which might be a reason for a second play through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099835421', 'num_games_owned': 673, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1527204356}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002975859', 'num_games_owned': 763, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482806685}
review:
From the same developer behind Hook, which I also really liked. This is just a minimalistic tile-matching puzzle game, no words, no achievements, just ambient music and lightly challenging puzzles. I didn't find it as challenging as Hook because there's really no way to fail in klocki, or even make any invalid moves... I guess the worst fate that can befall you is aimlessly clicking around. But for the price, it's ultra-minimalist puzzle fun.

The only thing I might add would be some sort of par for each level; a few times I wondered how far off I was from an optimal sequence of moves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059995557', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482679404}
review:
I was Honestly expecting more levels...

Shame...

Played the one on Kongregate it was amazing...

PLayed this one and was amazed and slightly pissed off due too the sliding puzzle...

Worst part is if you play it in one sitting you can get 73 minutes into the game and complete it. Maybe even less if you have the wit too do it.

I reccomend this game to people who like minimalistic puzzles and have an extra $0.99 to spare.

review:
Too short.
The learning curve is easy to climb, but i wish there were more levels.

Having a klocki II and a klocki III would be nice, there is a huge potential for increasingly difficult puzzles.

Still, i recommend it, because it's very relaxing and pleasing to play, especially for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016869388', 'num_games_owned': 734, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1482582335}
review:
After a disappointingly small number of levels, most of which are depressingly trivial to solve, it abruptly restarts from the first level, just when it was starting to look like it might possibly eventually get challenging and interesting.

It has some nice ideas, but it's very poorly executed, and ends up being much more frustrating (for entirely the wrong reasons: not  due to difficulty, but to lack of it and the extremely small number of levels, and the even smaller number of even slightly challenging ones) than enjoyable.

If you enjoy puzzles you'll end up wishing you hadn't played it, because it's essentially a very short and limited demo or tutorial for a game that you would actually enjoy, but that won't ever be released.

I'm almost convinced the real intention of the developer was to troll the players. :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198068284909', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1482454310}
review: This game reminds me of The Witness with how it introduces concepts to you one at a time and then combines them.  At the end of the game there are some pretty tough puzzles that require you to combine all of the mechanics youâ€™ve learned. The game doesnâ€™t overstay its welcome, which I appreciate.  The last puzzle came right as I was getting the itch to play something else.  For a buck, you could do a heck of a lot worse than this. If you like puzzle games, definitely give this a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126592129', 'num_games_owned': 900, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1494623435}
review:
It's pretty good, but it'd be nice to have a DLC with more content because the game is really short and easy. Most puzzles take less than 30 seconds to complete. It only took my about 35 minutes to complete all the levels.

The mechanics of the puzzles are really nice, which is why I would love to get more content. I'm pretty sure people would be ready to pay another 1$ to get more content.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991465987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 278, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1657215465}
review:
Similarly to Hook, klocki follows a very strange experience curve. It starts out with nice but very, very simple puzzles. The mechanics are creative and enjoyable, but after 10-15 minutes, when you've swept through like 35-40 levels, you start to wonder if there's any more to the game than solving the puzzles in 2 seconds and clicking through them in 10. Just when you start to feel grumpy, it turns out that you've been through a very long tutorial, and the game hits you with a puzzle that suddenly features like all the mechanics you've seen before. Difficulty is still not extreme, but the game becomes a lot of fun - and in case of klocki, it also looks very funny with everything rammed into one plate / box / whatever.

Total playtime was a bit under 1 hour, so it's a short game - still good value for 1 EUR. Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108183039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 256, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1558933623}
review:
It's a line game. Which line game? All of the god damn line games!

klocki is a simple puzzle game where you basically have to complete shapes by moving around tiles that contain parts of the shapes. It's a simple concept but there are 3 different ways of moving blocks and atleast 3 different end goals to achieve and the later levels really test you by putting them together. At first, I was really bored because a simple mapping of shapes was required but it ramped up nice. I never felt stuck and overall had fun with it. I wish there were more levels, but for a dollar, I had an hour of gameplay and I'm not complaining.

The music, visuals, and animations are super nice too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098799317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1646508160}
review: One of the best geometric puzzle games I've ever played. I like games that throw you into gameplay with no explanation, but allow you to figure out the "rules" by trial and error. Klocki is a very pleasant game to play, with beautiful smooth graphics in soothing colours. There are a variety of mechanisms that get introduced as you progress through the levels: rotation, swapping, etc. and it's fun to figure them out. After a new mechanism is introduced, it starts you off easy, and then begins to combine them into quite complex puzzles that are challenging but not frustrating. It's not entirely clear whether there is only one solution for each puzzle, or if you simply have to find a solution that meets the criteria, but it's fun to think about different ways you could solve it. I could play this game for hours, and was just thinking "I hope this game never ends" when it brought me back to the beginning. Aww. This game is similar to Zenge, which was equally calming and entirely too short for my liking. As with that game, I would love to see some Achievements to make the game even more replayable. For example, complete a puzzle in under X number of moves, or complete a puzzle without triggering the error buzzer, etc. Overall, this is an absolute bargain, and either a good way to kill a few hours, or a nice way to infuse your day with a few rounds of brain teasers. More! More! More!

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198071746166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1494804625}
review:
So relaxing i melted into a puddle of abstract shapes.

A charming little puzzle game for a super cheap price.
Klocki is about as simple as they come, with lovely minimalist aesthetics and a nice bit of ambiance in the background for you too. But don't be fooled - there's a decent amount of levels to keep you entertained, and the game boasts a well-implemented system of progression that'll keep you interested with new mechanics every other stage to constantly test what you've learned so far.
The only issue i really had was that it touched on the potential to be a lot more challenging but never quite got there, and the lack of any menus whatsoever meant the you were constantly in the dark about how many puzzles you've done/how many you still had to complete. But i'm nit-picking here, it's still very enjoyable, and i guess a bunch of unnecessary menus would have spoiled their smooth, super-clean look.

What's that? You haven't bought it yet? C'mon pal it's not even a quid

author: {'steamid': '76561198100770256', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1480703289}
review:
Really great little puzzle game.

I totally recommend this game!
Definitely worth the 1â‚¬!

As you can see from the screenshots on the shop-pahe, there are different types of mechanics in this game.
It gets pretty fun, once the different riddle types start to mix.

Thoughts for improvement:
A place to pick a specific level, or at least a counter in what level you are, would be very nice.
Also maybe add an end achievment, like it is done in Hook.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089639059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1480268630}
review:
The game concept is nice, but it's like playing just a very long tutorial.
I went through the whole game, hoping levels would have grown harder. Unfortunately, out of 82 of them, only 3-4 are decently challenging. All the others are basically a "let's tidy up a bit and put this very tile where it's obvious it belongs", but there's nothing to actually solve.
I'm sorry to give a negative review, but this game is so easy it turns boring after a couple of minutes.
